hTbS0wUv894_MTsDpWTHBA.text: Honestly..... the Food kinda sucked. The Mac salad was probably the best thing on my plate. The boneless short rib was little tiny hard pieces and way over cooked. Kalua pork was maybe the worst I've ever had. Chicken Katsu was over cooked and hard. If you want a real plate lunch this place is not for you. The dude behind the counter was slow and needed help. Our order took hella long to come out. I hate driving home pissed I spent my money on something I didn't enjoy. We also ordered two ice creams and while we were waiting a man asked for a sample for his daughter and the girl gave him one the same size as what we paid for, before we even got ours! How about fusing your food and service with some quality.

et34HuBW_-B5k1iYSxPaBA.text: This was my first visit at Fist of Fusion.  I was running late for work.  Decided to try them out. I placed an order over the phone.  I arrived about 10 mins later. My order was ready within 5 mins of my arrival. I ordered a Notorious RIB taco ($2.99), an Island mango chicken taco ($2.99) and a Mixed plate ($9.99): my choice of protein was Notorious RIB x2 +$1 per serving, 2 scoops rice, stir fry vegetables and salad for my 2 sides. Overall order with tax was $19.43.  The chicken was good by itself.  If I have to come back I'll order just plain chicken with just the mango-avocado salsa. The beef short ribs were too sweet for me.  I would have liked it to be a bit less sweet. I couldn't put enough lemon to kill the sweet taste.  Then again it is Hawaiian.  duh! The stir fry vegetables were mostly onions and red peppers and came with 1 slice of green zucchini and 1 slice of yellow zucchini.  They forgot to add the kimchi salsa on my Notorious RIB bowl.    Yes this place is good to hang out and chill.  I'm glad I tried this place out before I took my family and friends here. When I'm hungry and it's convenient I'll come back for another try.

gJAO3Gv_4sAnrl5V0Y-fSA.text: Due to the staff  I was written up at work because I had to leave work twice to fix the mistake they made to my order.

QDbcizNzMR3QbCrjH2LxaA.text: I tried this place for the first time last week. I work at the Sola Salons in the shopping center so this place has been on my radar for awhile. I ordered the Chicken Taco with Mac Salad. The food is delicious. Cute little place tucked in the corner of the shopping center.   I took off one star because the service is slow. I wouldn't recommend if you're pressed for time.

Ez3fcakQX0QakKTYmg38rg.text: Today was my first time here & it was amazing from the decor inside to the customer service to the food!!! I ordered the notorious RIB bowl boneless meat & I got Mac salad & pineapple as my sides & a spam musabi it was so delicious. Everything had so much favor! The inside was so cute too the color on the walls the painting it was so cute & the customer service was just amazing! I hope everyone comes here & it gets so busy they have to open up a billion more locations! Lol

RC-jF-RpMBxO5m7y9pgNyA.text: The best Garlic Chicken in VegasCrispy, juicy & perfectly seasoned. The wait time is not too bad & the customer service is awesome. Very clean & welcoming. Very giving on their plates, lots of food & not bad for the price.

It's very clean inside and the employees are friendly.  Been here 3 times already and i absolutely love their Kalbi Ribs.   They have 3 sizes, kiddie, regular, and mixed plates and also appetizers, desserts and corn.   Check it out!

JKEvZFNEZd-kkC_7zbJu9g.text: I love this place for their Katsu. But it's 50/50 because sometimes they over cook it. I tried their short ribs and was sick from it. But they have a good variety!

gA3vOLFAgIZskbIQUvsyyg.text: Came from Los Angeles and had to stop and eat here. My husband and son ate here last time they were in town and truly enjoyed their meals. The restaurant is clean,  the staff is friendly and the food is delish and the servings are generous. I will definitely be coming back as soon as we can :o)

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Been waiting a long time to eat here :o)

3hXbm3r50ULNec_6MK7Ucg.text: Usually go to another Island Grill and this exceeded my expectations!! Not only was the food delicious but service was spot on which is definitely lacking at the other Island Grill we used to frequent!!   The Kalbi tasted almost like my mother's, food was all hot and fresh and if you get the chance to try their honey sriracha or honey garlic wings.... DO SO! Don't hesitate!!    We will most certainly be back!! Job well done!!

9eLzTl2POB73s8OMOB_WSQ.text: This place is merely okay.  With Island Flavor up the street, the only justification I can see for coming here is for the healthier-ish version of everything.  Even then, the only thing I liked was their Yelp Check-in special of the crispy pork belly.  Everything was a pretty healthy meh.  I got a rice bowl, with the short ribs and the kalua Sisig (based on the recommendation of the cashier) with brown rice, with mac salad and grilled pineapple.  Everything in the bowl was a meh, and my SO def was not impressed.  Liked: Crispy pork belly as a free check in  Disliked: pretty much everything I paid for  Considering the price, quantity, and quality, I rather pay double at Island Flavor, but get twice as much and at a taste and quality that don't make me regret my purchase.

pX3KcKxGQeNQHSqjNHSQcA.text: The Loco Moco was super flavorful and the portions are very large. Lots of fun looking corn to try next time.

RAW2fGs81uVfRAYfYvHlPw.text: Such a bomb place! We ordered the unicorn corn which was so cool so pretty. We also ordered the hot Cheeto corn which was so good. The corn was perfect and flavors were on point. And also had there really tasty tropical lemonade. And how sweet of them to have given us complimentary churros they were interesting sweet and a little hit on salt was incredible. Definitely don't forget to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3NA74PAq4Hz_juizfzFRTQ.text: Quality food, Good Vibes, & reasonable prices. Can't go wrong.  Foods I've ordered:  Short Rib Taco - 4.5/5 Kalua Pork Taco - 4/5 Kalbi Plate 5/5 Pork Belly Sisig 4.5/5 Veggies 3/5 Fried Spam Musubi 4/5  Only thing that was "disappointing" was that the veggies were 70% onion, and weren't very "veggie", but I won't dig a Hawaiian restaurant for their veggies. Food was delicious.  I refuse to tell you guys how many times I've been here in the last week since finding it.

zGNXKlwKkuLMDljY1CdOyQ.text: Worst "Hawaiian" food ever in Las Vegas. Very small portions. Oily and fatty food. Selections are limited. Will never go there again, spend your money elsewhere PLEASE.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fattiest piece of Kal-Bi ever. And they have the audacity to charge $2 extra for this (only 6 pieces of this size total).

yJ6SEVVsfRW6zxX__5S83w.text: This place is a little hidden but finding the corner it's tucked into is worth the hunt.   They are always friendly, fast, and have fair portion sizes. The flavor is unique with variations of traditional sauces that compliment each item I've tasted.   Fun names too.   There's also a little story about how they got their name but I will let you find it out and add to the treasure of searching for this spot.

PzbQGpXrq70TAsQoMxGHbw.text: Ordered:  Notorious RIB (boneless short rib) with brown rice and a side of green salad.  My food and the service was really good! The food was made to order. The only reason why I gave them four stars instead of five is because it does take about 25-35 min or so for your order to be ready. So if you're going to this place during your lunch break, I suggest ordering your food ahead of time.   Would definitely go back!

pnrTPy6k9qwMdR2-4p7hDw.text: Amazing restaurant and great service. Very creative in their dishes and something new to the island feel of food!!!

Pog lemonade is so fire when it's hot outside. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but staff make the difference. GZJm7Z56XKiDmx3NbHOaRA.text: Came for dinner with the whole family. I had an island rice bowl. It came with two choices of protein, rice, and two sides, which was grillled pineapple and macaroni salad. Which was very good. Quite an impressive place with very tasty food.  Definitely will be coming back!

t1Lhh3lphlNSJsXlKPVdDw.text: BS + I really tried to like you guys.  I really truly did.  I just left this place today and had to write a fresh review in my brain unlike their side salad.  I been dying to come here since December.  I read about the sisig always running out and at 12pm I couldn't believe you guys don't have it.  Ok first, let's talk about the location and space.  The place is in the corner of Buffalo (in a little strip where 7 Eleven and Sola Salon can be found) hidden in a corner.  The bad thing is there is a new building erecting in front of it and it will block the sign when you are driving by.  It will literally cock block the restaurant.  The place has parking all over it but it's packed.   When you come in you will notice how tiny it is.  57 seating capacity but tighter than a virgin elephant's butt.  I mean you are squeezed in a table.  It's still nice to see the wall paintings and signs.  It's chill.   There are three TV's in picture frames which is so 2000's.  They are blasting Hawaiian artist on them.  The restrooms are super clean and nice.  The decor of the place is nice including the tiles and facade bamboo in front of cabinets.  The waitress who took our order was super smiley and nice.  She repeats your order which is nice.    So now for the bad parts of the rating.  First, you have to line up by the cashier to purchase the food.  Then you have to get up when your name is called to pick up your food.  Something like an IN-AND-OUT.  Which I think kills my experience here off the bat.  I messed up orders because people in my party of 6 wanted a lot of food.  I mean the menu is not huge but the food selections "seems" yummy.  So, 20 minutes later they call us.  I ordered the loco moco - super disappointed.  It was served on brown rice which is dope but and it's a huge BUT the beef patties were overcooked and gravy tasted burnt.  It was a 9 out of 10 on the SALT SCALE.  Like seriously salty even  to kill a snail with no contact.  I also ordered the CHEETO corn - it was my first time ordering it and it was fun to eat.  I enjoyed that part.  My father-in-law ordered the Notorious PIG taco - super dry meat and the veggies look old.  Then the infamous SIDE SALAD.  Holy crap for $3.99 all I got was chopped lettuce in a small plastic container.  Are you serious with this? not even a tomato? Carrots? an olive? Damn.  He also ordered corn and he said it was messy but I think he was ok with it.  My sister-in-law ordered some fried chicken since the sisig was sold out.  She said this place was subpar.  She also ordered the corn - regular.  She liked it.  My wife ordered the tofu dish which was average.  She barely ate it since the tofu didn't taste fresh.  My brother in law ordered the Notorious PIG burrito which was huge.  Looked fun to eat.  He was more happy about being there since the decor was nice.  Overall, this place was average in the food if you are not used to eating at spots like ISLAND FLAVORS or my second choice OHANA.  Which to me holds the highest regard for authentic Hawaiian dishes.  I love that place but I wanted to check out local spots.  I heard lots of great things  about this place and really wanted to like the whole FILIPINO-HAWAIIAN fusion thing.  But to me they did an ok job. SORRY GUYS! Hopefully the menu changes.  I wanted to give this place a BS + just because of this and the corn.  I was really not happy  with my food and I hope they listen to this plead.  MAKE YOUR BEEF BIGGER and LESS SALT!!!!  * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE! it's fresh

hpTEEBZxV70AM-Riy7TIlA.text: Saw this place while driving around looking for something to eat so decided to try it. Being from the islands I'm always down for some Hawaiian food. Nice small place...clean and lady behind register was friendly.   I ordered mixed rice bowl with kalbi and chicken katsu to-go. I gotta say I was kinda disappointed when I got home. They forgot my katsu sauce which is annoying cuz without sauce it just ain't the same. The kalbi was little too salty for my taste. Mac salad was fine. The portions were small compared to other Hawaiian food spots around town. They gave a lot of rice and sides to make it seem like a lot. Sucks that it wasn't a good experience cuz I live nearby n would keep coming back if food was good.

K8O74pwxu5pp_W-SocBkSQ.text: We decided to check them out today and give them a try. The food was really tasty and lots of flavor. We tried their chicken katsu, short ribs, shrimp plate and the pork belly.  It was really good. We will definitely be back and also recommend it to friends and family. Great to have another restaurant with a taste of HOME

hGAEXAwAffRUY_mOL3_DTA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while so my family and I finally came today. Definitely having Hawaii on my mind constantly, this place brought me back there. Ordered the garlic shrimp plate and let me just say, the portion size is VERY generous! They hooked it up with a lot of shrimp! Bomb flavors in one bite. Kalua pork nachos on hit too. Spam masubi also for the win!!!! Loving this place, the vibe and the wall art. All the food is sending me straight into a food coma and it's 3 in the afternoon!!!! Goodnight!

bRookZEd3Ja0l--1Nmzv0w.text: Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try! Being from Maui, its always exciting when a local food joint opens up. My boyfriend and I decided to drive across town to try it.   The interior and the structure of the restaurant is nice and welcoming. The location was not hard to find at all and parking was not a hassle.  I ordered the Keiki size with white rice, Kalbi, and Mac salad. We saw that people recommended the lemonade so we got that too!   Through pictures the food looked amazing, but we were disappointed when we got to try it ourselves. The rice was hard, the Mac salad was bland, and the Kalbi was okay. The only item I really enjoyed was the lemonade. On the car ride home we even started to feel a bit sick.   As far as service, one of the girls there was really nice and checked up on us every now and then. The girl who took our order wasn't as friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wm5vMrDHFdHq5M9zbJ35UA.text: This is my first time trying Hawaiian food and I must say, I am in love. The place is small, so be sure to come at a good time. To order your food, you go up to the cashier and order your food and drinks then when your food is done, they will bring your food to you.   When our food came out, we were not expecting huge proportion of food. I was so surprised when my food came out and I saw how heavy my bowl was. The food items that we ordered was amazing, every food item had different combination of flavors that complimented each other very well. This place was not a disappointment.

nSwPe58n7LPr-QH-zpTGiA.text: I thought the food was good, but nothing to go out of my way for. The service was good and everyone was really nice. They have a variety of options and even some elote. I'd give it a try If you want to try something new. I just like other island food better.

6HJKzFYqEP07H-HDMGOPOQ.text: NOPE.   Customer Service needs major - M A J O R - retraining. There was no greeting walking in or even at the register ordering, mind you there were two tables of guests -that's it. The girl had a "WHAT?" look on her face. She incorrectly input our order, we had to repeat it to her 3 times. And she STILL got it wrong. Please.. read our journey...  ORDER: Katsu: ALL BATTER AND OVER FRIED/DRY  Kalbi: The kalbi was flavorful but was incredibly chewy. I can tell it was over marinated. When your oversoak/over marinate meat in a salty brine like kalbi marinade, it draws out the natural moisture and turns the meat into jerky.  Mac Salad: The mac salad had no mayo or that the mayo was absorbed into the macaroni because someone put cold mayo into hot, freshly boiled macaroni. Either way - no mayo, no flavor, just no. Pork Tacos: We got PORK NACHOS instead because homegirl at the register couldn't tell the difference between pork nachos and pork tacos on her screed apparently. DA FUQ.  Experince:  The music was loud. Oh my goodness, incredibly LOUD. And when you're in an island inspired restaruant the last thing you'd think you'd hear is Michael Jackson's thriller... during the summer... on a shuffle repeat with Backstreet Boys, Celine Dion and Whitney Houston. It was very, very, VERY ODD.   We sat and our order arrived but WRONG. Instead of pork tacos we got pork nachos. We said we didn't order pork nachos but pork tacos. Instead of admitting her fuck up, she said - "oh, it's on the house." So thinking it was on the house we tried it but wasted it because it was lacking any salt or flavor. Honestly it tasted like the pork was boiled in water. Such an an insult if they think this is what kalua pork tastes like TBH.   Anyway, we continued waiting for the pork tacos but the pork tacos never arrived because instead of inputting pork tacos at the register, she put in PORK NACHOS - even after correcting her at the register THREE TIMES. So the nachos were never really "on the house" she just fucked up the order and was hoping we'd what? Forget we ordered tacos??! I as so upset that I threw away the receipt to see what was rung up. Bad on my part but after correcting her 3 times... I mean, you'd think she got it.  A woman had come out and apologized. She ketp asking are you sure you didn't order the nachos? I KNOW WHAT I ORDERED. DON'T TELL ME WHAT I ORDERED. And if I really did order it, WHY DID YOUR EMPLOYEE SAY IT WAS ON THE HOUSE??????? because SHE fucked up.   Between the flavorless food, the sucky, SUCKY, sucky service and the blarring out of place music - it physically hurt to be there. IT HURT.

AG_NXCQoKBYMM2ox0lc_AA.text: First time here after seeing the foodie influencers post delicious pics, definitely had to come give this place a try.  Fist of Fusion definitely exceeded our expectations, especially since it is filipino fusion.. thought it would be similar to other infused restaurants in the area but we can't wait to be back to try other items on the menu! We wished we could have ordered it all! Location is kind of hidden but love the atmosphere and vibe it gives off, great service. So nice & welcoming. The food is ono! Definitely must try the POG lemonade & take advantage of their check in offers.

FFtqrH6uKHUL3vaNMGWaYg.text: Just finished my meal at Fist of Fusion.... ...I had the 10 Piece Garlic Shrimp... ...was Ono... ... but the surprise which is worth return visits is the Won Ton Chip Salad... ... The Won Ton Chips are a nice surprise but what it's distinctive flavor is the dressing they created... ... I had to get a side order to go it was so good... ... aside from that dish... ... what they serve "da bess" is their Aloha... ... you are greeted with a loud Hello from front counter person... ... today it was Sweet SHY Charity... ... very friendly and engaging... ... I watched her preparing someone's burrito... da ting was so packed with beans and udda stuffs... I commented to her "not going close you know..." .... Charity confidently responded by saying she always closes the burrito because she's had so much practice... when she pau by my account it wasn't so much of a burrito shape but one "Burrito Ball"... .... I even suggested to rename it a Burrito Ball... Charity laughed so hard while she dismissed my suggestion... ... so if you order the Burrito Item... call it a Burrito Ball so Charity will flash her beautiful smile... so worth it...

S_vQFXCtD8rY8xs6ylrkqA.text: They improved since their grand opening in Vegas! My new "go to" selection was their kids bowl with the boneless short ribs and the tocino spam musubi. The cashier was really nice and offered me a complimentary drink.   good things ~ - boneless short ribs weren't dry  - meat was tender enough to not use a knife  - the cabbage + house sauce was on point  with the rice  - mac salad was okay  - rice was okay  - musubi was  !! order extra tocino sauce with it & thank me later   bad things ~  - somehow all the fountain drinks tasted bland   overall it was a great experience! although from past experiences I don't recommend their sisig & chicken katsu because it doesn't taste as good as other places that are known for those dishes.

mcCunJvgrqkOta15Z-lRQA.text: This place is AMAZING! Everything that we got tasted delicious and the staff is super attentive. 10/10 will comeback for sure.

bq9IaASIhGgDsx6TOA-bCQ.text: Very nice girl in front but the Kahlua pork was dry and unappealing and the veggie side was over salted. Citrus sauce in top was weird, teriyaki sauce tasted like simple syrup but the brown rice and grilled pineapple were good, so I guess there's that. Gotta stick with Island Flavor in the future.

ZdOWgYgbTSHMXAImZs93Kg.text: Wanted to check out a new place for work lunch & stumbled upon this place (thanks to the construction on buffalo). I was so worried because I only had 30 minutes to spare and wasn't aware that they cook the food fresh to order. Thankfully, the girl up front was understanding and helped me worked it out. I wanted to try the garlic shrimp, but that was gonna take 15-20 minutes. She decided for me to do the "boneless Kalbi" since there was extra made.  Size: I got the kids bowl, just because I don't really eat that much and that comes with one protein, rice, & one side (I got the macaroni salad).  The bowl: inside the bowl comes with cabbage, topped with kimchi and drizzled with spicy mayo.  The combination is so yummy, I was mixing it all together. I asked for more Kimchi on the side just to kinda give it more of that flavor.  Overall, I like it. The bowls are very customizable. BUT, I'll be coming back for that Garlic Shrimp! The staff were nice and the ambience is very Hawaiian. They even had this big TV that showed music videos of Hawaiian music. I definitely feel like I was eating in the island ;)

L_bwiJfcbfmK8f9izg_RHQ.text: Go here.  Get the shrimp plate.  Get the short rib burrito.  Get the lemonade.   Get corn.

Mrm_HnDd2YUDVmznfghcmg.text: I love that they have different types of corn! The Uni-corn was a very fun one that I got! Will definitely be back to try the bowls they have !

eiPxa2HrA0H9ZVngu9PYpg.text: Tried this place a few weeks ago and just got around to getting a yelp. The food was really delicious and the staff was really friendly. The kids loved the uniCORN and thought it was super fun. Just a tad pricey for a take out place.

rAyQCHPSOo6_K7hm3KNZ_g.text: We happened to come upon this restaurant because we were in the area. It is a Small restaurant with limited seating. Good food. Unfortunately they were so busy that even though I know they were doing their best in keeping up, both of the meat on my mixed combo plate of short ribs and boneless short ribs were very undercooked (very rare).   I liked the two sides-stir fry veggies and edamame.

s8urzN2X5sVBKd505Uth5w.text: Tried this place for the first time today.  Super friendly staff and the few dishes we ordered was tasty. So glad that they are located near our home. Will be back to try more dishes!

Mq2fgX4GpGyip10Za0Fi5w.text: Food was great.  Notorious R.I.B. Burrito Garlic Shrimp Teriyaki Chicken Sesame Chicken Spam Musubi Crispy Pork Belly  All Items came out hot.   I especially enjoyed the Crispy Pork Belly. Its was CRISPY as Lechon should be and also melted in your mouth. The cabbage salad surprised me with the refreshing, crisp bites of apple. The dressing was amazing. I ATE IT ALL!!!  The Garlic Shrimp was more than filling with 10 pieces of shrimp. Shrimp was excellent. Nevermind "Peel & Eat", I ate the shell too.   The finisher was also a surprise. We tried their Furukaki Churros.....OMG...You must try it before you leave.   I will definitely be returning.  Great job...and Mahalos to the Staff.

LN82NZZhV7_ulv9XrSy2Ow.text: I got the two item plate for $10. The veggies were great. The Macaroni, teriyaki chicken, and katsu was ok. Not sure I'd come back. I'd rather go to island style down the street if I were to crave Hawaiian again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ihzC9P9HSJU8SbHLpSKwPA.text: My boyfriend and I came out of our way to try this place after seeing it on Instagram and we were extremely disappointed. We eat Hawaiian food regularly since my boyfriend was born in Hawaii his family has always been big fans, and the portions are so small here compared to basically every other place in town we've been to. We ordered a double bowl with chicken katsu as both the "proteins" & when we got the food there was barely any chicken on the plate to the point it was spaced out to almost look like more, and you could see the huge servings of rice on the bottom. Since it was our first time we didn't know better and ate it (I wish I took a photo first since I considered it hoping to leave a good review after I ate, but I was just too hungry) anyways after we ate it we saw another person eating a smaller size bowl with just as much chicken katsu on it as ours, because we were so curious we came to yelp to check, and basically every photo on yelp, even the smaller bowls, had the same if not more chicken than what our bowl had. Overall the food had decent flavor, but didn't wow us anymore than the next place, and because you pay more for less we won't be giving it another chance.

ABjZgPvSjuA8uYWVieaZQw.text: I've been to a few Hawaiian places & this is hands down the best one I've been to! I've tried multiple items on the menu and have never been disappointed. I would definitely recommend. Whomever is morning shift is always spot on with their food! Props to you!

1E6v7apGtM2_mmaAb6Ph8Q.text: Just finished our lunch at Fist of Fusion and left completely happy. We were warmly welcomed and our food was served hot and fresh. I got the sesame chicken and my wife got the garlic shrimp. I loved that the mac salad wasn't overly creamy or thick. The amount of shrimp that came in the bowl was awesome!! They definitely don't skimp. We finished our meal with a churro..... Delicious.  This place is within walking distance so there's no keeping us away. we'll be back soon!

LP_lQUgsRnNh1Or9AExmPg.text: I am updating my review because the owner himself reached out to me and was very concerned with my experience. I told every detail and he was very apologetic. The fact that he reached out to me shows that he cares about his customers. Which is very impressive. My coworker and I decided to give the place a try again. We were welcomed right away. When we were ordering they walked us through the menu. They offered a drink, dessert or corn on a cob. We felt welcomed. The food was good (I recommend to try the crispy sisig, it was delicious), pink lemonade was also a favorite and the restaurant was clean. I am giving him the 4 stars for taking the time to reach out to me and for the much better experience I received on our return visit.

kc9ca0B_9dwZBlYajoO9Uw.text: We were so excited to try this place because we consider ourselves plate lunch/Hawaiian food connoisseurs lol. Unfortunately the seasonings were all off (it was pretty clear they were not tasting what they were cooking). The soda machine was down so no beverages which was a disappointment since there was a group of us for my husband's birthday. I had the shrimp plate and it was SUPER salty and not up to par with shrimp trucks on Oahu. People were very friendly that worked there but all in all not as tasty as were hoped for.

9ngy3aG0jlGgHIeRk8PZHQ.text: I was super excited to try this place because of the reviews and the pictures but I will never come back. The staff was so rude, I went to the counter to let the girls know that I was missing my drink they completely ignored me then one of them went to get it, put it in the counter and walked away. I wanted to have a nice lunch with my son but I felt so disrespected.They weren't busy at all either.The food was super greasy and didn't taste good. It was a complete waste of time and money. I have never been treated so bad at a restaurant before, but there's a first time for everything. Hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

JT1eL-91JLQuwM1brShumw.text: I love short ribs, so I ordered a bone in short rib and boneless option. This is was worst short ribs I've ever had! Very disappointed. The boneless ribs were dry and flavorless and it was overcooked. The bone in ribs were very low quality. The Mac salad was good though. Will not be coming back.

C7trXDd7YHchsNsytxQjmw.text: Food was good but I definitely don't recommend getting the corn. I had to wait for my corn to be made which I didn't mind but when I finally got it was cold and had no taste ! Definitely disappointing .

AWPCCpiMS4Y4QD7q_EdnLA.text: I wanted to like this place. I really tried. The food is seriously lacking in flavor and the free pork belly appetizer we got was hard as a rock. Someone could chip a tooth on it for realz. The people were really nice, but with so many other delicious options in town I won't be back.

A0ASprryB3HSaPH0bjrhig.text: The garlic shrimp was delicious and a good sized portion. I def wanna come back and try the rest of the menu!

1JiEi76Dtvy5troQWMOFDA.text: The restaurant has a pretty decent menu. I ordered a taco and a bowl, which I ended up trying 3 different meats from their rather large selection. The taco was decently good, however I must say the bowl was completely tasteless. The brown rice along with the meat were all very bland and under seasoned. I found myself trying to put different sauces on it just to try to bring out some kind of flavor. Unfortunately a little disappointing since everything on their menu and all the pictures online looked delicious.

gm68QRDZYedUlw1YCzekOA.text: Came to check this place out for ourselves and i must say that i like it. Very aloha spirited staff that makes people like me feel like we're back in home in Hawaii. Really good sized portions and tasty food. Will definitley come back again! #supportlocal

kb5vO7h_eIHPh5Y0Pq7nJQ.text: Great and friendly atmosphere as the staff was quite helpful with the array of selection from their menu as well as getting the food out promptly. Downside was that the chicken was over cooked and didn't have taste. The food over all was ok missing the flavor in a few dishes but the manager did try to rectify the situation by giving us a "remake" the next time we came in. Definitely an island themed/vibe there for sure which was nice coming from Hawaii. The restaurant has a fusion mix which is a blend of ingredients of different places. Must try!!!

dIs1Z5nnEx3EZO1oGOeOaA.text: I heard so many good things about this place, but my experience was not good at all! The restaurant was small and cramped. The staff was somewhat friendly, but not very professional. The food was the biggest disappointment because it was bland, and looked like a plate of soggy rice & meat.

MOe62jE_9USbZ-Jw9W1CXw.text: The staff here are very friendly, and helpful! The food flavors are definitely worth a try. I found the short ribs a little grizzly but the sauce was great! It might not be your thing because it is new and different and some people can't appreciate that, but you need to give them a try.

c7lTw25XUJmXFdIThMGUvQ.text: Always good food.   Very consistent.   The staff is really friendly.  There macaroni salad is the best in Las Vegas.   The loco moco gravy is also the best in Las Vegas.  There gravy is amazing.  Mahalo

RrLCqY0kYaTdXyc222UvkQ.text: The food is really sweet for my preference. I ordered the Katsu chicken and the Kalua. The Mac salad and edamame was not sweet of course. Nice presentation, but too sweet for me. Most likely will not come back here.

2VAZ8zXzjTgqIATot4Xr9w.text: My belly is happy! I fell in love with Fist of Fusion when I first ate at their Hollywood location. I was excited to learn they have opened their second location, in a nice developing community in Las Vegas. Parking is free and super easy, right out front. They are serving their standard classics like chicken teriyaki and notorious RIB. Parking is free and super easy, right out front. They are serving their standard classics like chicken teriyaki and notorious RIB, fresh and made to order. They have an expanded menu at this location, but unfortunately, I filled up on the delicious mango salsa and chips, so I didn't have a chance to try everything on the menu. Guess I'll have to go back! The chef was cooking up some new items, like honey siracha wings, and was kind enough to let us sample! I love how this is a family owned business, and unlike any other fast casual restaurant. So delicious! the service is fast! And the staff is super nice! I can't wait to come back!

jbNPi2w8XgeLcaKBtxlsNQ.text: Umm I was expecting some "ono grinds"- but in reality it was" oh no I need a refund". I ordered 3 bowls and one of the bowls had a hair on it... bruhhhhh. Then when i finally tasted my bowl it was bland, Mac salad was dry but  chicken was alright . My suggestion for this place is to add seasonings,  the hype was not met rather go to aloha grill .. #disappointed something missing

Ncml7KGQLpUh_wkcGfoR6g.text: It was okay. Came mostly for the garlic shrimp. I haven't been to Hawaii so I have nothing to compare it to, but it wasn't what I imagined.  I gotta go to Hawaii and see what it's really about!  the rib meat was pretty good. The best thing was the crispy Tocino spam musubi.  It just fell apart and was really messy. Had to experience it for myself though.

g0EMgMMju8whf6klIiBaVQ.text: Omg best Hawaiian food ever  I'm not Hawaiian but I've tried quite a few places and this one takes the cake. The bowls and tacos are amazing

3O5J5mIBdXPSDLtiCstxkw.text: This is the best Hawaiian bbq spot in the state hands down. The food has only gotten better each and every time I go. I have absolutely zero complaints. Depending on what you order there might be a slight wait time because everything is basically made fresh!!!!

BX14RGIx96hHplI9E0kLiQ.text: I seen this place on Instagram, and the food looked so amazing! When I got into the restaurant, the gal who took my order didn't look like she liked her job,  she did however get my order correct. But somehow the cooks didn't. It took forever for our food on a slow day, and When it came out they had forgot my veggies and gave my partner Mac salad on his dish whdn I asked for no mac salad for grilled pinapple. Then they brought out the pineapple when my partner was almost done with his meal... the veggies they brought out were not fresh, and it was like onions and bellpeppers???.... and my katsu was cold... but they managed to make the 3 piece chicken wing hot, but I didn't even want those...I was expecting all Katsu...We just feel like the pics were so off compared to our experience... which sucks because we wanted to love this place.

kNtPfcdYlr8EBudwrCrTSQ.text: Wasn't a huge fan of the food. Went in there excited to get some awesome Hawaiian food, but the flavors were just disappointing.

Ll2UuiPqPDaH5BmIHRyjfA.text: Great atmosphere, great people, great food. We had the notorious RIB burrito (local plate lunch wrapped into 1 burrito), loco moco, and the seseme chicken bowl with grilled pineapple, awesome kalua pork nachos, and Kalbi (winnah)  Good feeling for this taste of home being close to home. Can't wait to try out more of the menu. Welcome to the neighborhood!

Xhmt9w90XboBHJ_BTJ3GWQ.text: Place recently opened up and decided to give it a try. Outside is clean, huge doors, and a surprised welcome as we walk in. It's a small joint but it can definitely be a family place to eat. I got the Tocino crispy spam musubi and the short rib rice bowl (bone in). Pretty damn good food and good portions too. Their story is pretty cool and posted by the bathroom. They also gave us complimentary churros before we left too. Highly recommend giving this place a try. Average pricing, good food and excellent customer service. Would definitely go again.

GS7mpydCPugoEeL7bvH4eQ.text: Their food is pretty tasty and the service is excellent. I'd definitely go back. We weren't sure what to order and they gave us great recommendations which were great. The next time we are in Las Vegas we will definitely eat here again.

KSuBHtbnCxOCdja8H1a9Ag.text: If there was an option for negative stars, they would get it. Corn on the cobs came out after our food then needed to be returned because they were cold. Cx5sY1mvmSKJln99UHd0ng.text: This is a legit Hawaiin restaurant, didn't eat in but picked up to go. Ordering online was simple and quick, and order was correct. Teriyaki chicken bowl was so good a with plenty of rice, veggies and grilled pineapple. The R.I.B. bowl was equally delish and my daughter ordered it with the Mac salad. My hubby had the R.I.B. burrito which he also enjoyed very much.

KVDkSVM2uVgq0eBG7EA4vQ.text: Came back after owner promised me a free bowl and it was so much better then last time. I appreciate the level of costumer service the owner gives and just want to say that this place will be once again my regular spot for Hawaiian food!

MP8gAiWz19vRDyheEZhu8g.text: When I first saw the pictures I thought this is love.   Mac salad in a burrito? Yes please! However, the menu online doesn't match what is on the website. I wanted the rib and chicken burrito and I said no kimchi salad as it states on their website that kimchi is included. Sooooo I felt like a dummy. My husband and I ordered the chicken plate burrito and the other chicken burrito with cheese and no Mac salad. Obviously the second chicken burrito didn't make an impression but that chicken plate burrito was delish! I can probably eat that any day if it wasn't loaded with so many carbs! One burrito is def more than enough for lunch and I actually only ended up eating half! The spam musubi was also delish but I was full from my half of the burrito.   Overall, it's a win win. They are opened on Sunday's now and I will be back!

sf3BdmqR4IrcsxpIvcNiTg.text: Wow! I forget how much I can enjoy Hawaiian food!   A friend of mine recommended this place and we loved it. I always have to talk about the bathroom so let me start now... It was immaculate. It was squeaky clean, new and nice. When we walked in, I couldn't help but notice the high ceilings and bright blue tealish walls. It was eye-catching and made me really happy.  The girl that took our order was super duper sweet. She even offered us a free churro to each of us. I thought my break yo mouth teriyakiburrito packed a punch of sweetness and tang. I must've been really hungry because I enjoyed every bite of it. Also, there's an awesome check in special for a pork belly appetizer. It had little dices of apple which was a pleasant surprise for me.  I can't wait to come back for more good eats and the friendly and fast service.

eMLAkx0Do5x2s7JKaWBtcg.text: If you're looking for a quick fix... this is definitely the place. I ordered the garlic shrimp plate with brown rice, grilled pineapple and Mac salad. The Mac salad was a little sweet for me, but the shrimp was cooked to perfection. The only thing I needed was a little extra garlic butter sauce (from the shrimp) for the rice. It was a bit dry. Otherwise, the portions were generous and the price was good. I enjoyed my food and experience for the most part. Definitely a trendy hip spot. Nice vibe.

h5XCWjD85A7hstLtaUJD_Q.text: Two words... Furikake churro! Wat you know about dat?!?! Perfect marriage of sweet and salty, Chef Ronnie you da man!   We're creatures of habit but hubby and I agreed we're gonna try different things every time we come here. For this visit I got my much awaited sisig, brahhhhhh get it! It's umami in your mouth with crispy pork belly skin. It is a must try! But unanimously our favorite eat of the night is their grilled chicken teriyaki, the secret is in the sauce. Made in-house a process that takes 4 hours which Chef Ronnie is very proud of, rightfully so. It's the best teriyaki sauce I've ever had. Hubby says it brings him back to his childhood days where he and his dad would eat Huli Huli chicken in Nanakuli. That's priceless!   Today we had the pleasure of meeting the wonderful owners of Fist of fusion, Chef Ronnie and his gorgeous wife Lisa. You're treated like Ohana when you come in, Chef Ronnie goes from one table to the next talking to diners, making sure everything is good that's very commendable. They also take pics to add to their Ohana wall, how cute is that! According to Lisa a breakfast menu is in the works, super excited for what's to come, think Macnut pancakes!   We've found our new favorite spot! Go check them out, you won't regret it. Support local. ONOLICIOUS!

cL3SxV4ExXhAuk0rzqVLDg.text: Love this restaurant! Great service, amazing food but I do wish they had more seating because when it's packed I either have to wait for a table or take it to go.  The mac salad here is great & my favorite is the garlic chicken wings. I'm not a huge fan of their slaw, so I usually just ask for extra mac salad. The spam musubi is delicious & the fact that they fry the spam gives it so much depth in texture.   Def one of my fav Hawaiian spots in Vegas!

05oWcfIDWw6vy6KNOv3BnQ.text: Sweet baby Jesus this place is delicious! I've passed it many times because I assumed it was standard Hawaiian like L&L, or Ohana. Nope! It's more like Braddahs which, conveniently, is no longer in the area .   This place is like your standard taco, burrito, rice bowl type restaurant, but with a Hawaiian style twist. The primary meat selections are a kalbi type boneless short rib, chicken, and pork belly.   For lunch, I had the "Notorious R.I.B" burrito which is the marinated short rib meat with rice, Mac salad, and a kimchi slaw. While waiting for my food, they brought out a sample churro. I'm not big on sweets, but it was interesting that it had sort of a coconut sugar on it and some seaweed flakes. A bit sweet for my taste, but I still ate the whole thing.  I also had a fried pork belly appetizer. It comes in a bowl on top of some apple coleslaw type deal. It was really good, but too much food for me at this point. I still ate most of it.   I'll definitely be back once Buffalo is done being torn up.

Es5fDTCBSnGZpsw0qrPb-g.text: I'd eat here vs L&L! They could give a little more In portion size especially for the Kalbi  But overall cooked fresh!

qDJY5M8egSyumeF0FhJQsg.text: This was our first time trying this place and we were the first customers on Saturday.  We got the crispy tocino spam musabi, kalbi bowl with Mac salad and brown rice (they were out of grilled pineapple) and honey Siracha chicken wings.  The crispy tocino spam musabi was amazing that I ordered another one!  The kalbi bowl was good, but surprised they didn't have any grilled pineapple. The honey Siracha chicken wings had really good flavor, but they were not fried crispy at all.  Food overall was good and we will be back but we will ask for the wings to be fried crispy and we hope they have grilled pineapple next time.

pgc44VTcvPoDiO8h3-_hYg.text: This place is awesome! I'm always trying new places to eat especially food from back home.  It's hard to find places that make it taste like back home  But this place was one of the best yet.  Portions were huge. I ordered a Katsu burrito and I couldn't finish it. It was so ono.  The staff were super friendly too! As well as the owner. I'd definitely come back to this place as well as recommended it too everyone.

dM4tTdkfXwxSrIBQPBtbVA.text: I was excited to see this place open up walking distance from where I work. Ordered the teriyaki chicken bowl (small) with brown rice and sauteed vegetables, to-go. Made a last minute decision and got myself a tocino musubi and free pork belly app wtih yelp check in.    PROS + good portion, small bowl should be enough to fill me up for lunch without the last minute impulse orders  + friendly staff, big smiles and greeted with "ALOHA"; apologized that I had to wait awhile   CONS - put in my free pork belly app order shortly after I ordered my main meal, but felt like I waited a lot longer than I needed to for it (party of 3 after me all got their orders before me) - rice in musubi wasn't sticky enough to old it together, fell apart after my first bite - very small portion of pork belly app, there were only a few pieces on a bed of slaw; it was free but I probably wouldn't order again  TAKEAWAYS * get the small bowl again for lunch, get something other than the chicken teriyaki (short ribs, pork sisig) * get the mac salad, always (sauteed vegetables?! what was i thinking?) * try the burrito, if you're feeling dangerous

xivwM6T1lF0PPA0pzShm5g.text: This place is by far my favorite island food eatery and I've tried almost all of them! The food is tasty and they serve large portions. Very well worth the $.

498AiPiIM5_eoz_Vtumesg.text: Underwhelming to say the least. I've been here twice and both times the atmosphere has been, for lack of a better word, annoying.   And to preface this I am also confused by their name. I thought this establishment's name was Island Grill because First of Fusion is SO small on their building.   Okay, let's dive in... (This is funny, you just don't know it yet)  The first time I ordered a combo plate with shrimp, edamame, and their mac salad which was just eh, in my opinion. I even upgraded to shrimp and felt like I paid more money for less food. I received maybe two pieces of medium-sized shrimp and a whole lot of sauce. I'm thinking the shrimp drowned in the sauce and disintegrated into the sauce? Not sure how else an establishment could serve SO little of a protein that is considered an upgraded charge. I wasn't mad about the amount of sauce because I only eat so I have something to put condiments on BUT id like to feel like I'm inhaling some sort of substance. The mac was regular, nothing to write a review home about. Also, I think the edamame is a waste of a side because there are no special flavors to the pods, not even salt. Get something else.  Flash forward about three months, I saw a mac burrito of some sort on Instagram and saw it was from Fist of Fusion (not knowing it was the island grill I had already written off). Looked super good, and I even thought, wow I've never been here before let's go check it out.   Pulled up and was like "Oh... I guess let's give it another shot." Although I was slightly annoyed walking in, I tried not to let that sway my judgment. I found out the burrito was called The Notorious RIB. I, being the pescatarian that I am, ordered shrimp instead of the pork and paid the upcharge fee of $2. I know you're probably thinking that this review is wasted because I didn't get the notorious RIB the OG way, but if it was so notorious the way it was why would they offer upgrades? If anything I should be getting a better product. After waiting an unusually long amount of time for a counter ordering facility I reviewed my food. It looked bangin, just like the photo, so I was a little more upbeat (even snapped a photo). Took a bit into it and tasted the regular mac salad, cabbage, and no shrimp. Hmm, okay, so I bite around on the other side. No shrimp. That's probably because there were once again only two pieces of medium-sized shrimp inside my WHOLE burrito that was the size of a small child but PLENTY of sauce (please see photo). Once again, I found myself asking if the shrimp drowned in their own sauce and disappeared.   I know I personally won't be back. I see you Fist of Fusion. You can't hide behind your sauce.   2 stars for the reggae music selction

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9s3kCfzn2e8bWtPS7UOICw.text: Went here for a late weekday lunch. Great atmosphere, albeit a tiny dining room. The music made it feel like you had escaped to the islands. Staff was friendly. I did not know what to expect in regards to the level of service and speediness of food delivery so to speak. You order at the counter, then find a seat. They cook the proteins after you order so it does take some time for the food to come out.  The food portions are pretty large which is great considering the lowish price. Good bang for the buck. The food quality was tasty as well. Very flavorful. One minor complaint though. The ingredients in the burrito I ordered were not evenly spread throughout the burrito so some parts were real saucy and others were more on the dryer side. Still pretty tasty though. I would come back!

jgxLLxZf2tsis53TjX21KQ.text: Woah!! Nice chill spot for some island love. The food is delicious and price is fair for the amount of food you get! Loco Moco is a huge dish, enough for 2 people ask for sunnyside up egg for runny yolks or over easy for a balanced dish. Tocino fired spam musubi is simply amazing and that sauce the atmosphere is chill vibes makes me wanna visit Hawaii and soft drinks are refillable, plus really clean bathrooms  will definitely be coming back!! Thanks for the great service and food!!

-0DCZm-dDdaLulVc-EZEnw.text: Hawaiian cuisine is not something I've been exposed to, and Fist of Fusion seemed like a safe but logical choice to dive in and try authentic Hawaiian eats. The grilled pineapple and avocado sides were a great healthy compliment to the mixed plate of juicy garlic shrimp and crispy chicken katsu. I enjoyed my lunch here and ability to create your own meal so I definitely want to return. Fist of Fusion is tucked into a newly constructed plaza off Buffalo / Warm Springs.

OA430wsZ4tJZN_FTQG9vaQ.text: I tried the garlic shrimp plate that I saw posted online for a while and it was as delicious as it looked. 10 pieces of lightly breaded shrimp in a garlic sauce. It was served over white or brown rice and a small side salad and scoop of macaroni salad. The POG (passion-orange-guava) lemonade was very refreshing.the staff is very friendly and enjoy their job. I will definately come back... also thank you for the churro sample. Nice end to the meal, please add them to the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp plate
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. POG (passion-orange-guava) lemonade

iDx21yKklThI4Xji24mJCQ.text: I just had to check this place out after seeing the yummy pictures on Instagram. Props to whoever does the page because it definitely got me in the door. The food was delicious. I ordered the plate lunch burrito, spam musubi and a drink. My total was $15 and some change. The burrito was amazing. It had white rice, grilled chicken, grilled veggies, cabbage, mac salad, and two kinds of sauce - yum! The spam musubi was standard, but I love spam musubi. For me the food was 5 stars. The service on the other hand needs some work.  When I placed my order, the girl told me 10 minutes but it ended up being around 25 minutes. Most of the food was already cooked, so the workers just had to basically assemble everything. There were only 2 girls working  though and anytime someone came in, one of them had to stop and cashier. I think things would run a lot smoother if they had one dedicated cashier. I almost had to ask for my money back because it kept getting later and later with no food. Seriously a burrito takes like 2 seconds to make, especially since they just had to put the ingredients on the tortilla and roll it up. The musubi was already made. I finally got my food but because it was so late, I had to rush back to work and eat in the car (hence no pictures), so I didnt really get to savor the burrito, but man it was good. I will definitely be back, but I might place my order in advance if I am crunched on time.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room - small
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weird table setup

ocvSuS5ypcfPiy5e10s15w.text: My son had the crunchy spamasubi for lunch and dinner! He couldn't stop talking about it so he had to take me for dinner. I had the Kalua pork sisig with side of pineapple and it was delicious! My husband had the burrito with chicken and macaroni salad inside and I had it again for lunch because of the large serving. Definitely going back again!

Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JnDxGxnkqA0qj-YM7ASScw.text: Horrible the Kalua pork tasted like canned tuna. Mac salad had no flavor and rice wasn't fully cooked. Won't be coming back!!

AUCZIaKaBGYd4puM9kmjeQ.text: Transport yourself back to Hawaii. What a relaxing and fun place to be. Ok, enough about the decor. The food is incredible!  The beef is the perfect amount of sweet and savory to go with the rice and mac. The chicken bbq'd to perfection. Nice teriyaki and smoke flavor. The slaw is awesome and is a great touch on top of the meat. They also add a little kimchee to give it a tasty heat. This place is the real deal. Everything fresh and delicious. Taste the island and love. Super friendly and happy staff.  The best Aloha spirit in Vegas.

EJPADjdEYMjruBuLCED-Tw.text: Ordered sesame chicken which was decent but the pork belly sisig was not good at all. I didn't even finish it. There are a lot better Hawaiian restaurants in the area

t_k113qycbzF8PwWPPc1_g.text: Been here 3x. 1st was dine in, 2nd was order pick-up, 3rd was dine-in again.  Not sure with the others but they mixed up the orders of the sides with the proteins. How hard is it to have ordered 3 rice bowls and the next time 2 rice bowls? On the 3rd, it took 20 minutes to wait (my 2nd visit took only 10 minutes wait). It's just that there was a young couple aside from us who just finished ordering.  5 minutes later, a party of 2, then another party of 2, then 1. On the 20th minute they called the first couple's order, then ours came, then probably in 2 minute intervals everyone's orders arrived. Hoping my order was worth the wait, I was observing the staff kinda giggling around while scooping out rice and sides. With the wait, i expected rice to be warm, meat and grilled pineapple still should be hot as I expected because of the wait, but it was not. 1st and 2nd visit, yes my sides were mixed up but the food was hot so I refused to mind it. But this 3rd visit did not meet my expectation at all. Sorry, just being honest.

2Tph1hgyzcFNHpsDeo3x7Q.text: The tacos here are so good and the garlic shrimp was so close to Hawaii! Some of the best food we've had! Even the chicken had such great flavor!!

7FREYzpTlNZw_sqTP7J6oA.text: The first of three exciting restaurants coming to this shopping center, FoF has very good Hawaiian Fusion food. I think the bowls are a good value, with generous portions, and quality food. Really like the grilled pineapple side. I'll definitely be back, as FoF is a good alternate to the boring and predictable alternates in this part of town.

ft4KpMvCkyq9ShXHPi746A.text: Owner made contact to make this right and try there food again. Willing to go back for a second trial run. To be continued....

6JSoeMEutJOMZOxT2jMv_g.text: I went to F of F for lunch and liked the look of the restaurant  and the friendliness of the staff . I ordered a Hawaiian salad which consisted of greens , fresh pineapple , grilled chicken  cabbage , crispy wontons , and a sweet sesame dressing . It was fantastic ! The chicken was warm and browned , fresh off the grill and combined nicely with the sweetness of the pineapple and sesame dressing . The reason I did not give them 5 stars is that I saw someone eating a pineapple ice cream cone which cost about $4.50 , a little high for a soft serve ice cream but it was large . I didn't want that much ice cream so I ordered a small cone for $1.50. Small cone is an understatement  , It was a cone smaller than sample cones you get for free at ice cream places . A cone about 2 inches high and about 3/4 of an inch across with no more than an ounce of ice cream. A one bite ice cream about one tenth the size of a regular cone , one bite should not cost anything  , that should be the sampler you give customers who want as taste. Don't ruin the experience where everything is priced reasonably and than overcharge for the dessert , it leaves a bad taste in your mouth after a good meal .

fGqsXO4_INIYirFesjikuw.text: I ordered thru the phone for pick up..everybody was nice and helpful. The food is great. However my only neg comment is that the dish to rice and sides ratio is not equal..there is more rice and mac than the actual crispy pork sisig.  That's the only reason why I didn't give five stars. Because I am paying for the actual dish and yet I just got rice and mac.

sRTfzEY6Ufp4ZeSGYk0qJA.text: Checked in and got the pork belly appetizer!!! it was sooo delicious omg. they also let us try the nachos (it was alright, not the best). My food took super long to come out. I got the sesame chicken and it looked and tasted like the chicken Katsu except with sprinkles sesame chicken. Nothing too crazy. The portions looks tiny, but it was filling! Great customer service.

j3L51J2EE73BY20dmmM8jg.text: Great place to sit down and eat a good meal for a great price. The proportions on the mixed bowl were pretty perfect. I suggest the katsu chicken bowl, it was delicious!

nnucc9PQ8Q06P7it8rZn9Q.text: Hard to have given 3 stars. We are all about supporting local spots but I'm also all about supporting good food. We drove across town to try out this place. We were greeted as we walked in, nice little atmosphere and loved the island vibe and music. Prices are reasonable. Looking at spending about 23.00 for two meals and two regular drinks. We went to the front to look at the menu and girl ( no name tag) upfront asked if we were ready and I told her we were still looking. She was not personable at all . When we went in it wasn't that busy that she could of made an effort to make small talk with us and give us some ideas of what their top sellers were. She clearly saw us looking at their menu and their choices of elote . Though she did state if we had questions to ask. When finally ordering we tried to order one of their elotes and she said "oh we are out of corn". Should of put a sign up or even state they are out when we were looking at the menu.  Also only choice of diet soda was out of order. So what brought us here? We saw some pictures of their food on UNLOKT. Pictures they have posted look better than what the food tastes like. No flavor. Also another friend who is a "foodie" stated they were good. I got the chicken katsu meal. 1 protein, 2 scoops of rice, and 2 sides for $9.99. I got veggies and macaroni salad as my sides. Side means two tablespoons of macaroni salad and 1/2 cup of grilled soggie onions, a piece of red bell pepper , and 1 cube of zucchini. Maybe I didn't get their popular dish but no excuse to not have fresh veggies cooked and I had seen containers of food behind counter. Rice and veggies .. setup look like something at chipotle. So you know veggies are not cooked fresh. Definitely not a place to go out of your way for.

fjP2HR45GuQeT-I-r0tz1Q.text: Three of us tried Fist of Fusion today. Restaurant was clean and busy. They have a beautiful Hawaiian mural. Greeted with aloha and order taken right away. We ordered 2 regular and 1 large bowl. Sesame chicken, teriyaki chicken, and a teriyaki & pork belly combo. You get 2 sides. All 3 of us got grilled pineapple which was delicious. The stir-fry veggies were very good. My daughter had to split open all her edamame pods. The sauce that comes with the bowls is amazing. The rice was delicious. A regular bowl had enough that my daughter and I took home leftovers. My husband ate all his large bowl. I gave them 4 stars because we waited quite awhile. They did give us a free order of the pork nachos which were very good and huge! They seemed a bit unorganized as we had to wait for o e bowl and one piece of pineapple. Regardless of the wait, we will be back. The food was excellent and the staff was friendly.

W2ALrtVv7-Z5weaqeQRY6w.text: Just ordered chicken Katsu here and literally got my food right after I ordered: Made me wonder why it was so fast. Let me guess? Yeah the Katsu was old and they just threw it in the bowl with steaming Rice. Horrible Chef whoever is cooking back there is lazy!

sLeuhmKtcy8hHdq-aHFBeQ.text: If I was basing this review just off of what I ordered, the garlic shrimp plate, it would be 0 stars. Shrimp had no flavor (yall ever heard of salt?), rice was hard, macaroni in the mac salad was undercooked, and the second side they gave me was not what I ordered.   But what bumped this up to a three star review is I was having lunch with my dad, and he ordered a mixed plate of kalbi short ribs and garlic fried chicken. The kalbi is really good. I would go back solely for this. The garlic chicken was good as well, very much like chicken wings you would get down the street at Soyo or Bonchon.   As far as service, the girl at the register was not very welcoming, which is a turn off considering this is a Hawaiian place. Ever heard of "aloha spirit"?! Someone teach her how please.   Also the portions are kind of small for the price. Even though my food sucked, I ate all of it and was still hungry. And this ones not really a big deal, but the place gives off a young vibe that would be more environmentally friendly, but they use a lot of plastic: plates and covers, drink cups and lids, cutlery. But they do have those brown napkins made from recycled paper, so that's a plus.   Friends who recommended this place to me said everything they had was great, even the garlic shrimp. So maybe I went on a bad day? To the owner: Consistency is key. But I will be back here and try other things on the menu, as well as order that kalbi.

pHI7uz-kykSJbxl3dPtBMg.text: This place is amazing. I get the notorious R.I.B. Every time and it's an absolute slapper. The people are nice too.

rXhWYK_ZKRaswDDXw2mQ-A.text: Had this for lunch today. We placed an order online for pick up. Large order and it was ready on time.  Super excited to try this food. I had a large mixed rice bowl. Brown rice, notorious rib, tofu , grilled veggies and grilled pineapple. Also the miso corney elote.   The bowl was soaked in some kind of juice/thin gravy and cabbage all over the top of the bowl. The rice was soaked, veggies soggy. The rib was good but you can tell it is just stew meat. Tofu was fried well well done almost to hard to eat.  I did not eat the rice, veggies or pineapple as they were all soaked with the liquid.  The one thing that they got right was the miso corney elote. Steamed perfect and the seasoning blend was so good. I did ask for it to be cut of the cob but that was not done.   I hope that they take some of these reviews to heart and consider to change a few things and put out some really good food.

aS8k-vOQ4L6pCXaBJgwdZQ.text: I've been here on two separate occasions and I have to say even though this place is way on the other side of town for me, I'd definitely make the effort drive out here for their food. I've tried their Garlic Shrimp plate, Kalbi Short Ribs plate, Uni-Corn and Miso Corn-y. I have not been disappointed yet. Garlic shrimp was not overwhelming on garlic and had a semi-sweet taste to it. Kalbi was very juicy. Depending on the size of plate you want will dictate the amount of sides you get. The regular plate gets two sides and let me just say having grilled pineapple, toss salad or edamame as options makes me feel less guilty about my main dish. The corn on the cob options are very creative and with the prices being $4/each its very easy to get two and not feel ashamed. The service incorporates the aloha spirit from the moment you open the door till the moment you depart. With all these new and delicious spots opening up on this side of town, I may need to relocate soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp plate with toss salad and mac salad
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken taco with mango salsa

9fHNmXRxZN0Ez_KUX--KwQ.text: Every time I come here, their rice is ALWAYS wet and mushy. That's what happens if you add too much water in your rice. Besides the terrible rice they serve, I don't like anything else.   Their garlic shrimp is meh. The shrimp they use is NOT good quality. I feel like it's the packaged ones in the freezer aisle. I'm not paying $13 for that.  The spam in the musubi was paper thin, and super plain. Every time I've had musubis at other Hawaiian joints, it's a pretty thick slice and marinated or has some kind of added teriyaki sauce. The ones here is just soggy rice, spam wrapped in seaweed.  Their sisig was decent, but it wasn't anything to rave about.  My least favorite item on the menu are the tacos. The tortillas weren't served warm. They also came straight out of a plastic bag. I got about 4 pieces of meat inside the taco and it was served on a plastic lid. Definitely nothing special and it was easily something I could've recreated at home.   If you live in the area, I'd try Makai or Island Flavor for your Hawaiian craving.

3p-0R9GH0YxZMnEhIHz1NA.text: Love the kalbi short ribs. Seriously so freakin' good. The last time I went here they were out of the short ribs so I was forced to try something else. I got the crispy pork belly and did not enjoy it. The pork was soiled with grease and all I tasted was fat :( They were kind enough to prepare another dish for me since I wasn't enjoying the food, so I went with the Chicken Katsu. I'm not sure if it's because I've never had chicken katsu before and wasn't sure what to expect, but I didn't really like that one either. Maybe I'll try something else on the menu another time, but I would definitely come back for the kalbi.  My food came out in about 10-15 minutes both times I've been there so I can't complain!

rd4WHREm4hde2Fsan4JSyA.text: My first time trying the place. I came in about 8pm to order my food. I originally ordered their Mixed plate with pork belly, sesame chicken, Mac salad, grilled pineapple, and white rice. The lady at the counter says they're out of grilled pineapple, no biggie. Double Mac salad it is.   She puts in the order and I pay, while waiting she tells me that she just found out they're out of pork belly. So I substitute for chicken katsu. I figured since I was charged $2 more for the pork belly, when I had to substitute for a non premium item they would maybe give me a bigger portion to compensate.   Once I got my food I was disappointed with the total amount of food I got compared to what I had paid. The food itself was really good, and I would definitely go back to try it again (hopefully I can get the food I originally wanted to order). As a first time experience this was a let down for me.

yD5tI558Lgk18r1umNAMcQ.text: Ordered a 2 meat plate, sesame chicken and boneless  short ribs with macaroni salad and salad for sides. The sesame chicken is very crispy and I love how they use dark meat. The short ribs tasted more like the beef cubes from a beef stew that shreds. It was very tasty, but just wasn't I thought to be boneless short ribs. I also ordered panko breaded spam masubi. It added more crunch to the typical masubi and tocino sauce drizzle added more flavor.
