Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panko breaded spam masubi.

Q8EebZNXKKnmfar2DaLG5w.text: Customer service not the best, very nice in the inside, picture frames with tv's are awesome!   To be honest do not go off of Unlokt on Instagram and order the katsu burrito it's pretty gross! The teriyaki bowls we got were good but the only way I'd come here is it's closer to my favorite Hawaiian place.   Maybe it was an off day but I will give them other shot in hopes of a better experience and tasting product

UuqcFHRvOO8RdhiGHamG6w.text: The atmosphere of the place is amazing along with the servers. The menu is simple and straightforward which makes ordering easy but definitely have many options to make sure everyone who goes in comes out with something. They also have pretty big portion sizes which you can share with others or save for later. Definitely worth making it my go to restaurant for quick and yummy eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k0pyj3nwbF9LrKWH97aWlw.text: If this review was solely about the food food it'd be at least a 4 star review! My girlfriend and I came in last night for dinner after a long day and we were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was! I got the plate lunch burrito and she got the garlic shrimp plate, we also shared the crispy pork belly appetizer! All three of which had tremendous flavors! However there were a few downsides to each of our dishes, for my burrito it was sooo poorly wrapped that when I picked it up it was falling apart. I ended up eating it with a fork as if it were a normal plate lunch which was disappointing to me because I ordered a burrito not a plate lunch. As for my girlfriends plate the only downside was the shrimp wasn't crispy it was soggy if anything!  We got the strong garlic flavor however it wasn't crispy at all! Which was a bummer because you need a crunch on that plate of rice and Mac salad! And the pork belly was crispy but it came out cold and the spicy sauce with it all we could taste was Tabasco nothing else!  Sadly this review is about much more than the food so it won't be getting 4 stars today!   When we came in it was extremely cold in the restaurant, the employee working the register was even wearing a jacket. Now I understand you'd want the ac on blast in Vegas but it's September it was only 90 degrees outside and I think someone had just set it too high. (I did hear about 3-5 other people say something about it when they walked in as well)   The ice machine was out of ice and when asked we were told "sorry we're out" with a tone as if we were inconveniencing them by asking.    We both really enjoyed the playlist that was playing when we walked in however the music stopped while we were waiting for our food... it was super weird because it was only 7:55 so they were gonna be open for another hour but the dining room was silent. With the absence of music everyone in the the dining room could hear the employees messing around in the back which is what ruined my experience for me... we heard a guy talking about how he got laid last night(good for you dude, but that's not something all your guest want to hear while they eat!), we heard a girl freaking out because she messed up the teriyaki sauce and put way to much sugar!(again not something you'd want the guest to hear) and just a whole bunch of laughing cursing and messing around! I'm not saying that work shouldn't Be fun but when my food is coming out halfassed because young adults can't grasp the concept of treating their work with respect it pisses me off. We left the restaurant in such a bad mood because of the way the employees were carrying themselves. If we come back it'll be for takeout or a call in order which still worries because of the laid back demeanor and carelessness of the employees! You guys are representing not just yourselves but the company as well! Step up your game! It was such a disappointment on the service end!  As good as the food is this is not a place I would go out of my way for. Especially considering the amount of option for Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.

QEhwEQnXZkLZjTkcwfPpfA.text: By far the best Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas! Customer service was great, they are very attentive to their customers. The ambience is nice and very clean. Their chicken katsu was amazing, also the crispy pork belly siding was delicious. Will be coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Ewmga8rpH4RvyWeJI6y8A.text: This place is great! My personal favorite that I always end up getting is the Mango Chicken salad. The chicken alone is some of the best I've had; and that salsa I could have on everything! I also always end up getting a ear of corn as well; favorite is the Miso- corny! Even with postmates... this place doesn't disappoint!

vnk-a5_4F6YuSHYEQZWagg.text: This place is addicting!! By far one of the best hidden Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas.   Have not been disappointed with any of our orders. Always made sure to try something different. A couple of things that are on my favorite list: garlic shrimp, garlic honey sriracha wings, spam masubi, and the Uni- corn!! The POG (passion fruit, orange juice, guava) is a must have if you like fruity drinks!   Onolicious is the beat description for their food!!

acwNfE2Ac9rsbCM8LrlSwg.text: Decided to try this place because it looked fun and tasty. The music is a little loud but it has an inviting atmosphere. I love Hawaii so I enjoyed the island theme. I ordered a mixed bowl. I got it with white rice, garlic shrimp, stir fry veggies, and grilled pineapple. The bowl was overall pretty good. The garlic shrimp gave the rice a good flavor and the grilled pineapple was a nice twist. My only complaint is there were a few chunks of carrot in the stir fry veggies that didn't seem to be cooked all the way and it threw off the texture for me. I would say without the carrots it would've been better. My friend ordered their kalua pork and he said it was bland and had no flavor. I think I'll go back to this place again just for the shrimp!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed bowl with white rice, garlic shrimp, stir fry veggies and grilled pineapple
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed bowl with white rice, garlic shrimp, stir fry veggies and grilled pineapple

ckD0tveD3UTE2OF9QLPV0A.text: Incredible staff and food! Highly recommend the burritos, and the spam musubi! Price is completely fair for the quality and amount of food you're getting! Ask about their guava drink it is worth a try, sweet but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken plate lunch burrito, spam musubi, and guava drink

jMcUaqxNUO_JDaPFVlbB8A.text: I found this gem on yelp and thought...we needed to give it a try. The reviews were great and the pictures made me really want to drive over and give it a try. It was definitely worth the drive. We had the Kalua pork nachos...the beef rib buritto and the chicken plate buritto. It was a great place, amazing mural on the wall, reggae music playing and very friendly staff. The Kalua pork nachos were fantastic. They came out 1st. Crispy chips, pork, cheese, slaw and this amazing white sauce. The flavor of the pork was sweet and smokey at the same time.  I had the chicken plate buritto which had chicken, brown rice, honey Chipotle sauce, macaroni salad and I think slaw...my man had the rib buritto...the meat was intense...so tender and flavorful. The meat tasted as it was marinated in teriyaki, ginger and soy sauce...it was amazing. He didn't have it with the kimchi or the honey Chipotle sauce...the burittos were so large that I could only eat half and then this really nice man came over to our table (maybe the owner?) Asked us if we wanted to try the churros...on him...so we said yes. They came out hot and fresh...lots of great sugar and a hint of cinnamon and I want to say it had flakes of seaweed on them also. They were spectacular! There were some guys sitting at the table across from us and one had what looked like the bowl with the rib meat in it and it looked delicious...we will try that the next time we go...and the street corn... If you are looking for a great Hawaiian restaurant with fresh quality ingredients and a great atmosphere ....then you really need to come here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What was left of our Kalua pork nachos.... they were so good I couldn&#39;t stop eating them to take a picture!! Lol ;)
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was some amazing beef!!!
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken plate buritto...sooooo yummy!

7njxDrXpZZnVwKPgqi0lbA.text: Really really good menu options I wish I could have tried everything but I was very satisfied with the options my boyfriend and I chose!   Pros: - Bowl sizes and other options other than bowls - their Tropical Lemonade is A MUST!!!!  Cons: - seating is weird also the very first time we came here we had to leave because there was not enough seating and that was disappointing because they have enough room to expand some outside seating. - Food took a long time and it wasn't even packed so that kinda sucked:/

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tropical lemonade BOMB.com

hM8St4OkaN7tYo8V9Qi-6w.text: This was my first experience at fist of fusion and I was hoping for a better experience. I ordered a loco moco, chicken katsu, short rib, and Kalua pork sisig. The loco moco seemed relatively tough, but the gravy was pretty good. Short rib was tender and mildly flavorful. Kalua pork "sisig" might as well been called Kalua pork, instead of capitalizing on a trendy gimmick. But the most unfortunate occurrence was the metallic wire in the chicken katsu (pictured) that in my fiancee's plate. Not sure how it got in there but it was lodged between two pieces of katsu slices. Island Flavor still reigns supreme as the premier Island food hot spot, but I'm hoping for a better experience at fist of fusion one day.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Metallic wire in chicken

pk25CaEcd56wC-D3UjdFLQ.text: Came here recently with my bestie for lunch. New spot in the neighborhood.   (We were looking for chicken katsu for lunch which is hard to find during lunch hours in Vegas for some reason.)  I ordered the sesame chicken with is chicken katsu served with a sauce. I got mines with edamame and veggies.   Churro on the house.  Nice indoor seating. Hawaiian music for vibes. Love seeing Hawaiian food on the 9th island.  Would be nice to see a couple tables outside.  I would come back if I'm in the area for lunch.

1lIprDmZw4gGM6mDjmh8yA.text: So I found some really good reviews here and I wanted to stop because I literally drive down buffalo to get home everyday. Nothing was really good that I would come back with all the competitors in the area. The thing we were looking forward to is the ice cream. Unfortunately they needed to turn the machine on and said if we wanted to wait it would take a while. Boo!   Only thing I liked was the crispy pork belly! Yum   Hopefully I can come back and try some ice cream but we will see...

7HQb7oKviAdSOnGDhMnFcw.text: I wrote a review here about 8 months ago and decided to give them another try. It was a mistake. I went there with 2 of my supervisors and it was just the 3 of us so it wasn't like it was busy or anything. All 3 of us had issues with our orders. One of my supervisors ordered the kalua pig taco. The shell was so oily and it only had a little kalua pig and lots of cabbage. My other supervisor ordered the spam katsu bowl with the tocino sauce on the side. They gave her chicken katsu. She told them it was a wrong order and they remade it with sauce on top which she specifically asked to have it on the side. And I ordered the keiki sesame chicken with edamame as my side. My chicken was cold on the inside, it didn't look fully cooked. And my rice was soaked with water from the edamame and the other side was soaked with oil from the chicken. I'm only giving this review 2 stars because the guy handling all this was really nice and sincerely apologetic.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jT-um3Xnh66ksrsMt5RScw.text: My boyfriend loved it, and I thought it was just ok, so the law of the averages gives it a 4 star review. Now given that we arrived at after 9p on a rainy night, I'm willing to give them a pass- they probably thought that they were done for the night and then we come waltzing in.   The restaurant is a take out joint, but does have an area to eat in. It is decorated in lots of Hawaiian themed items and Hawaiian music playing. The servers were friendly and polite.  We both ordered the big mouth burrito with the chicken katzu. It's definitely a large portion, so it's worth the $8.99. I felt that my chicken was a little on the dry side, but the side of sauce included helped out. Nothing was particularly seasoned, but altogether it worked out fine.   I may give them another shot if I'm on that side of town again, but wouldn't go out of my way.

VloazTj0R9dGCp-rP7Z_eg.text: So this is Fist of Fusion Island Grill. You'll probably only see the "Island Grill" and the shaka parts of their sign outside and assume it's just another Hawaiian restaurant. It's not. It's fusion. What they serve is fusion. You've been warned. I'm not going to hate the fact it's fusion. I'm ok with fusion. I just wasn't a fan of their fusion. Came here 3 times so I was trying to give them a chance.  On my 1st visit I ordered the regular size bowl ($7.99) bone-in short ribs (+$2) with 2 scoops rice, mac salad, and a grilled pineapple on the side.  The pineapple was the best part and all it was was a grilled pineapple. The mac salad and short rib was nothing special. Sure the pic may look nice but I didn't like it it was more like beef jerky to me. I tried to order the free crispy pork belly app with yelp check-in but they ran out. I was there when they just opened for lunch.  On my 2nd visit I took the parents. We ordered 3 large size bowls of various items share. They messed up the orders twice. Once after the order was placed and one more time when the food was ready. I thought it was fixed the 1st time. The end result? One bowl was some bone-in short ribs and this kalua pork sisig with slaw thing. The short ribs were cooked differently this time. They weren't like beef jerky which was better but I still didn't like it.  There was also less pieces than my 1st visit. The 2nd bowl had teriyaki chicken and kalua pork sisig. The 3rd bowl had tofu and sesame chicken. There was bad words said while eating. No one wanted to eat more after sampling everything and the food remained untouched in the fridge over the weekend. The free crispy pork belly app was nothing good also.  The 3rd visit I ordered the loco moco. You can't mess up loco moco can you? There's nothing to it. Rice, fried egg, and gravy. The eggs had furikake on it which is how I usually make my eggs at home. The gravy was different. Needed more gravy not because the taste of the gravy there was just wasn't a lot of gravy in the bowl. A friend ordered short ribs thinking they were getting short ribs with the bone in it, you know the usual way it's served. Whatever was brought out I wasn't going to trade with him even though he was kind of looking at my plate.   They use paper bowls. Seems like they're trying to be eco friendly. A good amount of rice got stuck to the bowls. If you start scraping sure the rice comes off the bowl but with some paper from the bowl. Also it doesn't hold up too well on to go orders. Took it a few miles away and bowls were all wet.  Honestly I'd rather go to the other restaurants around the area like Island Flavor, Ohana, and L & L just to name a few. I'm going to Island Flavor now.

rUZFe1qfTPpvUhf3w0Tenw.text: I was super excited to try this place based on the number of photos flooding my IG feed. If you occasionally eat Polynesian food, this place might hit the spot for you, but if you grew up on island food, chances are you'll stick to your go-to spot after trying Fist of Fusion. They've got a cute little set up which totally gives off the touristy Hawaiian vibe.  Ordered a mixed plate which comes with 2 choices of protein. I chose the garlic shrimp that had been haunting my dreams thanks to IG, and kalbi ribs because I figured you can't go wrong with kalbi. It came with a couple different options for sides but in True Polynesian fashion I stuck with rice & mac salad. I feel like you can tell A LOT about a place by it's mac salad. I also opted for Island lemonade. The lemonade was super sweet and in no way reminded me of the islands lol. The food delivered look bomb. I tore into the garlic shrimp first and was so disappointed. Very bland with barely a hint of garlic. The Mac salad was as forgettable as the shrimp unfortunately. Thankfully the kalbi was good. There are plenty of island options nearby and I felt this one was meh. Sticking with my regular spot off of Durango ;)

s9LLjCn62CBX5HLvDS1PxA.text: Finally tried this place out for lunch today. It was ok. Staff was friendly and helpful. Coming from Hawaii, I expected a lot from this place. We ordered a bunch of food, from loco moco, tocino musubi, tofu salad, pork belly sisig, Teri chicken, kalua pork nachos, etc. they were all ok for us. The mayo mixtures that they added to most of their food as dressing or drizzles for presentations didn't go well with the food. Their chicken katsu plate burrito was pretty great though. Also, they ran out of short ribs! Mind blown! We went there on a Sunday right around noon....just about an hour after they opened. And when we got there there were only two customers. Idk. They might've just forgot to restock or had a big order of kalbi before we got there. Will we be back? Maybe after a while. We'll see.

WbM5sBONqyQQqoXlpBEF7g.text: I was excited about trying the food here after having read amazing reviews about this place. I chose the Mixed Island Rice Bowl ($9.99) with two scoops of Brown Rice topped with Teriyaki Chicken, Honey Sesame Tofu, Macaroni Salad, Grilled Pineapple, and a Tropical Lemonade. My friend also chose a similar order with two scoops of White Rice topped with Teriyaki Chicken, Kalua Pork Sisig, Macaroni Salad, Green Salad, and a soda fountain drink. In addition, they gave us Furikake Churro which is on the house.   Honestly, I'm not happy with the meal I ordered. The Teriyaki Chicken taste okay. The meat isn't as tender as it should be and the portions are quite small for a large bowl. The Honey Sesame Tofu is a bit on the sweeter side. If they could've add a little spice like Sriracha to it, it would've balance the sweetness and make the meal taste better. On a brighter note, I do like the Macaroni Salad and Grilled Pineapple. These are actually sides and are the only ones that taste good.  I was told the Tropical Lemonade ($2.79) had Passion Fruit, Orange, and Guava in it, but all I can taste is concentrated sugar water. Also keep in mind the best quality churro is served warm, crispy, and it's enjoyable to eat. The churros that we were given taste kind of sad, it needed more time to fry, its texture is so dense and chewy, and there is hardly any Furikake sprinkled on it. It's just massive amount of sugar on undercooked dough. I ended up taking most of my meal home. Thankfully I have bottled water in my car and I drank up that water like there's no tomorrow.

mr-GtYdlKNsgDrF59IBgHw.text: This Hawaiian/Filipino spot on the corner of Buffalo and Warm Springs Rd. is packed with island flavor!!! It's only befitting that Fist of Fusion Island Grill whose based in So Cal, opened their 2nd location on the Ninth Island aka Las Vegas!  Step in here and they already treat you like ohana with their warm smiles and "Aloha!" greeting.    What's offered up here are some Hawaiian and Filipino favorites served in taco, or burrito form. Island style salads pack some nutritional value, that's next on my list to try!  Or you can choose Island Rice Bowls where you can pick an additional two sides and your choice white/brown rice.  Well since Ive limit myself to not having meat, my go to order here is the Honey Sesame Tofu. The tofu is marinated with sesame miso dressing..So ono!!  Grilled Pineapple! - Get that for one of your sides!! Taking a bite into warm juicy pineapple is so onolicious!  When I ordered the keiki size Pork Belly Sigsig, for me...I didnt get stink eye. Perfect serving size for my post workout recovery meal. Eggs are protein! Pork Belly is brok' da mout!  Ambience - small space but good use of dining area with booths and tables. You got Sammy J playin on the video screen. Their surfboard counter/hi top with stools is where you'll usually find me.  Love staring at the mural.. a homage to Hawaiian and Filipino culture. Whoever the artist is..five stars to you too!! It's beautiful! The window faces the mountains...not quite islandy, but hey everything else here has the island vibe and ono grindz!

tsfr_cJDtvNzma2KKOyzAA.text: My girlfriend was the one that told me about this place as she drove by a few times and knew that I lived near by.   The next day, my husband and I attempted to go, on a Sunday at 4:59 pm, to which I could see they were closed and sweeping up. I visited the following day to pick up dinner. This is when I found out, this was their soft opening week and Sunday was their very first day.  I also learned from the owner/chef, what the correct hours would be: M - Sat 11 - 9 and Sunday from 11 to 7.  Being filipino and growing up in HI, one would think that I got this, but I honestly can say that the menu is different from other filipino or Hawaiian-style restaurants. For the most part, there's a twist to many of the items on the menu, which is a good thing.  It took me a few minutes to figure out what to order, plus my husband texted me to change his order twice!   With the two times that I have been to Fist of Fusion, I have some mixed emotions as to which are my favorites, because they are all so good. Coming up in first place are the sesame chicken, loco moco, kalua pork sisig taco and kalua pork nachos. For the tacos and nachos, they fry their own shells and chips!!!   The loco moco is made with mushroom gravy. Like real mushrooms. So very good.  My husband really enjoyed their Crispy Pork Belly Appetizer and furikaki churros.  The one thing that is weird about the location of this restaurant, is the parking lot. Make sure you don't back into the mound of dirt and unpaved portion in the middle of the parking lot.   Convenient location, good food, good people, and clean. 4-star rating for me.

-MttBRLwysrsmekNrry-Zg.text: I'm one local guy moved here 4 years ago. 1 word  BOMB - local term meaning soooooo ONO - Hawaiian word meaning so good. Recommend it! The atmosphere, the people working so much Aloha please keep that! I'll let everyone I know, know!   Food came out great, flavor was very good. Nothing was soggy during my first experience there, and the shrimp plate was big and fulfilling. Sauces was on point.  First thing, if you are going into an establishment and thing is for you, "I'm gonna yelp about this" the first time you step into the restaurant than you gonna look for the negatives. Just go in the place with an intent to enjoy yourself, your friends, significant other, parent etc and eat. And if your critiquing how your sushi burrito fell apart and blame the employees for not taking their work "seriously". BRUH it's not a full on Mexican place bruh. Some people place standards way to high, seem to eat out more than cook your own food and know "Flavor." And for the Garlic shrimp it's not suppose to be crispy like one guy complained,it's sauteed. Know your dishes before you open your mouth. I think some people's critique is kinda over the top with this place, like they are expecting some VIP treatment. They complain about the people working talking about their business in the back, when the thing is, enjoy the food and the atmosphere of the place. This is not one "private" area and everything gotta be perfect. Enjoy your dinner with laughter and fun with those you love or bring to this establishment. Some should realize when entering this place, it's a nice chill place to eat. The Vibe is local and if your really from the islands you'd understand the vibe. I felt nothing but pure aloha. The cashier was more patient with me ordering cuz a friend of mine recommended this place. And if they say "im sorry we are out" bruh relax not the end of the world. This place looks like a new establishment still building itself. So In local terms relax, and enjoy the grinds! Nothing but Aloha  Mahalo I'm actually gonna go there right now in an hour!

oD-6xOQ8l81Pjqv5SOEfzg.text: I was excited to try this place out when I saw the sign going up on the building. We tried so many lack luster Chinese styled Hawaiian bbq spots and I thought man this should be interesting to see how a Filipino Hawaiian bbq fusion spot will be. First off the place was well kept and clean, the staff greets you while you walk in, and the menu has just enough selection not to make you overwhelmed with choices. The only reason why I'm giving it a 4 Star is because the crispy pork belly was a little oily like it was fried in oil and not broiled, so the fat just held all the oils. The sesame chicken was good as was the boneless bbq beef. The garlic shrimp was not as how I expected or liked, it was in a goopy sauce that had a whole different garlic taste and a couple shrimps were undercooked. The panko fried spam Musubi was good but I think the price could be a little better for the amount given for sure. They have a super bomb drink here though that will be so refreshing on hot days or just in general, POG ( Passion fruit, Orange and Guava) lemonade. Super bangin. Overall I will be trying all the other stuff they got since it was pretty good.

e4Kuj-0xtJgQcgmvoeWH-g.text: First impression, pretty basic order at the counter style restaurant. Hawaiian food mainly.  Had the 2 meat combo. Had the Notorious ribs and teri chicken with rice and double mac salad.  The chicken was good, will get sauce on the side next time though because it spills all into the rice a bit too much for my taste. But it was seared well and had good flavor and texture.  The boneless shortrib (basically korean bulgogi) was pretty dissapointing as a korean lol. The marinade flavor was good, but the cooking of the meat was done pretty poorly. Looks like they arent using a hot enough grill, or they are just overloading the grill with too much cold meat. It was basically boiled marinated meat. Zero char or searing on the beef which is crucial in my opinion.   The mac salad was mac salad.   They did give me 2 complimentary churros which was honestly the highlight for me. They should sell larger sized ones for sure.  Overall it was just okay, I didnt really get a warm greeting either which is important to me being a business owner myself that cares ALOT about customer experience. The food was nothing to write home about. Might come back to try some other stuff if Im in the area.

nlPaIs495K75veRBNCq_Hw.text: Always on the lookout for new spots in town, we decided to give Fist of Fusion a go. Ordered a Large Bowl (2 proteins and two sides) Sesame Chicken and Kalua Pork Sisig. My sides were mac salad and grilled pineapple.  Observing the kitchen in action while we wait for our food, two cooks hustle (not in a good way)to get orders out as there are two people ahead of us and take out orders as well. A good 30 minutes pass and we finally get our order. Wifey luckily ordered a salad, but my bowl was a huge let down.  Filipinos and Hawaiians LOVE their rice. In fact, a pot of hot, fluffy rice is one of the first things you learn how to do in the kitchen growing up. The rice in my take out container wasn't hot, more cool to the touch, and  some grains were hard. Day old rice? Possibly, but that's the kind of rice you turn into fried rice, not serve it as is, especially when hot food should be hot, and for the prices you charge.  The "SISIG" was anything but...(simply a play on words)no jowl, no ear, no snout...straight up bland shredded pork butt topped with shredded cabbage and a white sauce. This was barely warm/room temp...its beginning to sound like a CON-Fusion of Filipino/Hawaiian food.  The Sesame Chicken (Chicken Katsu topped with sesame seeds and a sweet shoyu concoction) looked and tasted like it was prepared ahead of time and not made to order Inside wasn't hot, wasn't  juicy at all, and portion sizes for both proteins were on the skimpy side.  To make things worse, the mac salad was a bland mush, and the grilled pineapple was so sour, I spit it out as I proceeded to take a bite. Too many shortcuts and overall taste makes me wish I had read LJ's review first.   Another double edged sword is social media. Food should taste as good as it looks when its posted on Yelp, Instagram, or Facebook, but if you can't duplicate your delicious looking food consistently on a daily basis, then it's a huge disappointment ....NEXT!!!!

6jysoJyIADH_Xibh7XeBHg.text: *Updated review on the short ribs  I was informed that they had changed vendors for their short ribs so I had to give them another try, and this time, they were nothing short on the short ribs. They tasted soooooo much better! In fact, they were some of the best short ribs I've had in quite awhile. Super juicy, tender, and flavorful! If you're ever craving short ribs, FoF is currently thee spot to get them!  Also tried tried the Crispy pork belly this time, and it was really tasty! It had really good textures. The skin was super crisp, but the pork itself was really soft and moist. The cilantro lime sauce also gave the pork a nice kick to it.   And did I mention the guava lemonade? I'm usually not a huge fan of lemonade, but that drink converted me into a fan. So refreshing!  Service was friendly and accommodating as usual. Looks like I'll be coming back, tomorrow.

z1Trgu6M-uy1kExbImfhxA.text: Fist of Fusion is a great spot for a first date to screen someone for their relationship potential. Long story short, if a guy can hang through a trip here AND you get some action afterward despite the garlic breath from the Shrimp Plate, he's a keeper.   The Steps: 1. Insist on driving. If he doesn't complain about your speed/music selection or repeatedly ask why you're passing several other Hawaiian restaurants on your way to this specific place, that's common sense AND compatibility. 2. Insist on getting the Shrimp Plate. If he doesn't bitch about it being the highest price item on the menu, you're off to a good start. Bonus points if he takes your recommendation and orders the same thing, and then doesn't complain if you steal a shrimp off his order. Sharing is caring! 3. Chat through your meal and if you're still feeling it, refer to the first paragraph. Garlic is amazing and if that's a deterrent for him, he's not worth it anyway.  For real though, the Garlic Shrimp Plate is amazing- ~$14 for about 10 shrimp, doused in garlic, with plenty of rice, a scoop of mac salad, and a little bit of greens. The shrimp are large and fresh, and have been cooked perfectly on my two trips out here so far.   The menu isn't all classic Hawaiian, they feature Filipino and fusion items too. I keep meaning to try the chicken wings and the Notorious RIB burrito (complete with mac salad INSIDE THE TORTILLA) but the shrimp keeps winning me over. They also have elotes!

SeDt--tHus4IY6vBPQg5Eg.text: Three words: MONEY WELL SPENT. So glad this Los Angeles gem has made its way to Las Vegas! We waited a little for the hype to die down, but totally understand it now... We have been here TWICE in a week now! And it won't be the last time! You really get your bang for your buck -- the food is well portioned, filling AND satisfying!  The menu has a wide variety of hawaiian x filipino fusion food -- from appetizers, burritos, salads, tacos, entrees, and rice bowls. We both opted for the ISLAND RICE BOWLS: - Choose your size (KIDS $5.99: 1 serving of protein, 1 scoop of rice, 1 side) (REGULAR $7.99: 1 servings of protein, 2 scoops of rice, 2 sides)  (MIXED $9.99: 2 servings of protein, 2 scoops of rice, 2 sides) - Choose your protein (teriyaki chicken, Notorious R.I.B. boneless shortribs, kalbi short ribs, sesame chicken, chicken katsu, kalua pork sisig, crispy pork belly sisig, honey sesame tofu, teriyaki veggies) - Choose your sides (macaroni salad, green salad, grilled pineapple, stir fry vegetables, edamame)  I ordered (large island rice bowl): - NOTORIOUS RIB - SESAME CHICKEN - MACARONI SALAD - GRILLED PINEAPPLE - WHITE RICE  ...and I will continue to get this same order forever! The Notorious RIBs are perfectly marinated & cooked tender boneless short ribs, topped with a tasty slaw -- and the sesame chicken is so crispy & cunchy with a delicious flavorful side sauce that I just want to smother on EVERYTHING! The mac salad is a common necessary side staple, and the grilled pineapple is such a yummy sweet mix to add to the dish! We just barely finish our plate (even on our hungriest days) and just can't get over how satisfying, fresh and filling the food is! (He ordered the notorious rib, chicken katsu, mac salad and mixed veggies... but uses my sesame chicken sauce, haha.)  Will we be back? Without question! (We even had to vow to wait at least a week in between our next visit since we've been here so frequent!) Especially with this gem just around the corner from our house, located on Buffalo x Warm Springs next to the PT's Ranch. I love my order, but vow to definitely try other items on the menu (I have been eyeing the different kinds of elote like MISO-CORNY, or the KALUA PORK NACHOS and NOTORIOUS RIB BURRITO)! =)

xa0_B4GaND0o7wgsToOP1A.text: The location of this restaurant is so close to my work, I couldn't resist trying it out. I started with a crispy pork sisig rice bowl. The pork was super crispy and meaty, like finely chopped lechon. Next I tried the Kalua pork sisig, and the smoked shredded meat melded nicely with the crunchy jalapenos and onions. My coworker got the notorious RIB burrito and wouldn't stop going on about how amazing it was. Needless to say, I've now ordered the notorious RIB rice bowl 3 times since. The macaroni salad is delicious as well as the grilled pineapple. I also like the edamame option. It's easy to order takeout on the yelp app and it's always on time. If you like Hawaiian fusion food, this place can't be beat.

oTLfnDROKTitMipnwnBKlg.text: Fists of Fusion combines Hawaiian food with a Filipino twist. In pictures, the food looked amazing with large-appearing bowls with picturesque protein atop rice and mac salad. In reality, the serving sizes are much smaller. When compared to the nearby Island Flavor, which has become my standard for Hawaiian fare, it falls short.   For lunch, the garlic shrimp plate was reminiscent of those shrimp trucks back on the islands. I enjoyed the heavy garlic flavor, and the buttery finish, but for $14, everything else was quite small and lackluster including the sides of rice and mac salad. I did think the shrimp was cooked better than the furikake shrimp from Island Flavor.  However, when it came to the rice bowls, you get a much better deal down the street on Durango. The servings of protein were small and un-filling. On top of that, the meat including the pork belly sisig and teriyaki chicken were haphazardly tossed together in the bowls. I think this place is deserving of another try for their crispy tocino spam musubi and their colorful elote, but I can only hope that the real deal is as mouth-watering as their social media pictures next time.

bcuWRxCUoC3W2aDeDBHfbw.text: I saw this place on Instagram and been wanting to try it for a minute. I'm an islander so it was right up my alley. They had island music and a chill vibe. I saw on their Instagram theyd always post their garlic chicken so I figure I ordered that and try it. It was amazing! I licked it down to the bone. It came with rice salad and Mac salad. You can substitute that salads as well. The garlic chicken was so flavorful!! I loved every part of that plate, I sub the Mac for green salad and the dressing was amazing!!! And I ordered their tropical lemonade and it was bomb! Had a tinge of POG in it. (Passion orange guava). The islanders know what's up. I'll definitely be back to try the shrimp plate next time

rUL23b7IXMcGQJGPIcSzHA.text: Checked out Fist of Fusion for the first time. Located in the SW area off of Buffalo and Warm Springs. The small strip mall they are located in is semi new and still construction on going currently.  Parking was not hard to find maybe due to the mall not being overly crowded yet. Entering the establishment it is pretty small inside with limited seatings and a walk up area to order food. The menu has its local touches, being from Hawaii we are particular with our local food selections. The menu does have alot of local touches but how does it taste????  We give it a 4/5....   On our menu today was the Loco Moco, Hawaii folks know exactly what that is. Hamburger patties over rice smothered with brown gravy and topped with over easy eggs ( or however you prefer your egg) i like my yolk to be dripping all over.. mmmmmmmm!!!!! The hubby had the island rice bowls, they have 3 different sizes to choose from dependent on how hungry you are. He had the 1 choice meat (Kalbi short ribs +$2 additional) 2 choice sides (stir fry veggies and mac salad) and of course WHITE RICE but they do have brown if you prefer it! We also tried the fried spam musubi so ono!!!!! And they have a POG lemonade say whattttt!!!! Real good! When ordering we peeped some corn on the cobs with different toppings. Elote, Flaming hot cheetoes were some of the flavors but hubby opted for the traditional butter and salted corn.  The ambience is definitely Hawaii esque. Local jams playing and a beautiful mural of home. I definitely wanna be back to try the garlic shrimp plate little on the pricier side but that ono pog lemonade is calling my name!

Ifu0DEFJRAWd6O94_s7R3A.text: I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately I was so dissapointed! I came here with a co-worker for lunch, and it was packed! So I took that as a good thing. I observed several mistakes by the staff repeatedly; wrong orders, wrong sides, missing sides, and people going up asking where thier food was. At one point one of thier employees ran in with bagfulls of meat from La Bonita! That just looked terrible, at least walk in from the back? Customer's should not have to see that. This was a huge red flag for me. My order took 25 minutes to come out, plus they gave me the incorrect rice. I ordered the the sisig as my protien and it was pretty bland. Only the sides I ordered (pinapple and macaroni salad) and fountain drink were really okay... My co-workers spam masubi barely had any spam and was stuffed with way more rice than it should have, and her veggie sides were soggy. I also got a rice bowl, and it was honestly more rice than my proteins and sides. I will not be back.

VB2ZJkkj6GLEctXawTu_fQ.text: I'm in Vegas almost monthly and I couldn't wait to visit Fist of Fusion this month after watching a video of their "ono grinds" on a Facebook video on their "Take Me There" page.   My much anticipated wait to the restaurant did not fail.  Completely lived up to the video.   Everything about it was fantastic.  From the wall murals, to the music, to the entire island vibe, this was everything I had hoped.  Not sure if the workers were originally from Hawaii but they definitely exuded that True Aloha spirit.   I honestly wanted every single item on the menu. I actually ended up going back into line 3 times just because I couldn't make up my mind and wanted to sample everything.  I went to a fourth time bc I normally just drink water with my meals, but the POG lemonade caught my eye and when I returned to line yet again, the girl at the register comped my drink.  . I ended up getting the short rib burrito, honey garlic sriracha wings (which they catered to my needs of only the flappers!), and a kahlua pig sisig taco.   Oh my GOD, BECKY!!!   Every single thing had my taste buds doing a happy dance.   I wish I wasn't so full because I wanted to also try a shrimp platter and a few more Hawaiian fusion dishes.   I wish this was an AYCE or buffet because my mouth wanted everything on the menu but my stomach could only hold so much, haha.   I even bought 2 souvenir t-shirts!  Back in Vegas again in 2 weeks and cannot wait to return. I've already told my local Vegas friends about the establishment and they can't wait to go.  Two thumbs up, five stars, top notch local dining and I plan to return over and over again!

lDeYU7D9oJv18N4nQpFK-w.text: Found this hot and new on Yelp. We're in town from Mississippi to visit family, and we were looking for something that we can't get at home. Hawaiian/Asian Fusion fits that bill, as you can probably imagine. This is a counter service spot with a smaller, focused menu. We opted for the pork belly rice bowl and a short rib rice bowl. The small was plenty filling for a lunch portion and the flavors all worked. While we ate, a staffer offered us a churro on the house. It was amazing. It is covered in sugary goodness and addictively sweet! A+ for friendliness and helping us with the menu. Check this place out!

UBSvjx7gA2lShEZ8UEUE_A.text: Every time I take a trip out to Vegas, I always make sure to stop by since they closed their Los Angeles location. I usually order the honey sesame tofu island rice bowl. It comes with your choice of white/brown rice or substitute for green salad. You also choose one or two sides depending on the size of your order (kids/regular/mixed) The sides to choose from are macaroni salad, stir fry vegetables, grilled pineapple, edamame and green salad. The macaroni salad is my favorite!   The staff here are wonderful! The cashier is always so friendly and always smiling. Songs/music videos from the Common kings , Anuhea, j. Boog, and other island reggae artists are heard throughout the restaurant. It can be a bit loud at times but very enjoyable.   The restrooms are located at the back of the restaurant and always clean!   I highly recommend giving them a try and be sure to check out their Instagram page for specials not on their regular menu!

2YtGhvbRQPZhDQjYMseTgw.text: We came, we ate and now we (ok, just me) need a nap. Hahah, lunch time on a busy Saturday. Kalbi ribs - moist, tender and very flavorful. Crispy pork belly - oh WOW ... lau lau - yes,that's a ryhme, but, only in Hawai'i ;) Supah crispy brah and matched well with the creamy slaw. Check out the picture of our chicken katsu, kalbi ribs and freshly made churros w/furikake. Ronnie (the owner) was greeting the guests and asking everyone if they wanted to try the churros. gHRbiD93LdGuJ2youotfAg.text: Fist of Fusion is a great spot to get a delicious Hawaiian meal or a healthy meal. I went with a Mixed Bowl and chose Kalbi Short Ribs, Garlic Shrimp, Mac Salad, and Stir-Fry Vegetables. The bowl also came with two large scoops of rice. x00GpgdNmEvxy6NJYXGiRA.text: Looking at the reviews and see the advertised video on Facebook, I had high hopes for this place. I saw their burritos in the video and decided to go after work to get one. I ended up ordering platters instead because there were multiple things we wanted to try. I ordered a couple plates, one for myself and one for my husband. Mine was done right away and I had to sit and wait a good 15-20 minutes for his. There were only 2 other people in the place and one already had her food. By the time I got his, I left quickly because I was hungry and tired of waiting. We opened up our food and it looked really good so I was excited to try it out. And to my disappointment, all my food was cold, waiting for his to come out so I could get home and we could eat together. I wasn't very happy that I had to eat mine cold, especially after I paid extra for the RIB that I added. I'm sure the food would have been a lot better if I would have gotten to eat it hot. If one plate was going to have such a long wait, they should have waited and put both together at the same time. The food itself, was good, good flavors. I loved the RIB flavors.  On top of all this, the service I received when I got up to the counter, was definitely not 5 stars. The cashier didn't seem like she wanted to be there. Every question that I asked, she gave me attitude and made it seem like it was a stupid question I was asking. I'm sorry if it was my first time here and I had some questions. That kind of set the whole mood downhill as soon as I walked in, but since I was already there, I decided to order anyway.  Overall, I was really disappointed in my first experience here.

FPg2DCKPRBxUEDtRokgqiw.text: My favorite Hawaiian fusion place in vegas. I've tried many different things on this menu and they're always on point. The garlic shrimp plate is reminiscent of the famed north shore giovanni's shrimp truck. I sub the rice w salad to feel a little better about myself. And then I ruin it with their SUPER DELICIOUS (and probably very fatty) dressing. Ok then I've got a secret to share. I get their sesame chicken plate, extra chicken obvi, and use the sauce that comes with it and mix it with the salad dressing. voilaaaaaaa. enjoi! My favorite side is the grilled pineapple.  Ok, don't take offense to this FoF, but I think the tacos are good but they need work. The price is a little too high for the value of food. When I think sisig...i think ULTRA crispy and overflowin w sodium and umami.   On to the tocino spam musubi: My only complaint is........CAN U GIMME MORE for one order?   When you're done stuffing your face, you can also get different flavors elote like rainbow colored elote bc you gotta flex for the gram.  I can go on and on because i've tried so many different dishes but I think the standout is the sesame chicken. try it!

orAM3KDYQt_FF8McA3lUKQ.text: A fistful of flavors and a fistful of fusion. That's what you'll be getting at this Hawaiian fusion eatery on the Southwest side of town. They serve a variety of different entrees like traditional plates and the ever popular customizable bowls, but the star of the menu has to be their Notorious R.I.B Burrito. And the recipe for one of the main ingredients, the marinated beef short ribs, is literally the thing that started it all.   You're first presented with the burrito, evenly split into two, allowing you to take a peek of what's inside the stuffed behemoth. It's filled with what's basically in a regular Island Rice Bowl, but with several fusion elements. It's got plenty of the normal stuff, like the rice and chopped cabbage, but further in, there's the teriyaki, the honey chipotle, and the kimchi salsa to add the small kick of spice. There's also a serving of the mac salad in there. Boy, oh, boy was that a good call on them. And last, but not least, the star: the Notorious R.I.B marinated and diced boneless short ribs.  Just one bite into the burrito, and you'll know this whole flavor combination was meant to be. Unsurprisingly, it's got loads of sweetness to it, but with an ample amount of savory flavors and the rice to counteract it. Each ingredient stands out wonderfully, having a taste of the spotlight one by one. I cannot say enough good things about it, except that I wish there was more of it per order.   This burrito might just be my new guilty pleasure and that's saying a lot.

The prices are somewhat steep for what they offer IMHO.   I haven't gone back after my first visit so,  that might be an indication of how I feel about the food.

p5S1hAv5RpfWfGhmKOaVYw.text: Fist of Fusion Island Grill  I'm sure glad that people love Fist of Fusion because I sure didn't.  I'm just not a huge fan of a salty Loco Moco and a soggy & tasteless chicken Katsu. That's exactly what I got at Fist of Fusion.  The portions are small too.  Each hamburger patty on the Loco Moco was about 2.5 inches in diameter or about 2 ounces in weight.  The side of chicken Katsu was also on the small side and no more than about 3 ounces.  It's safe to say that I am not a fan.   I don't see myself coming back anytime soon.

BruXtTO3nC-sJrcvapmAeA.text: Decided to try this place out since I've been seeing their ads all over Facebook.   Fist of Fusion - as the name states - is a fusion style restaurant. They fuse both Hawaiian food along with Asian Food and maybe other cultures.   Walking in.. you'll get a little sense of the "Aloha Spirit" and "Cali Vibes" with music playing and a lot of light coming in through their windows making it nice and bright in there..   Upon ordering.. Staff is very friendly and explained what they had to offer..   Decided to get their Chicken Katsu Burrito and Tocino Spam Musubi and POG Lemonade. (Yes, I can eat!)  Food came out in a reasonable amount of time and everything looked and tasted great! - it did make my stomach feel a little uneasy afterwards though.. (not used to fusion style foods) and the POG Lemonade was perfect for the 100+ degree weather in Las Vegas.   CONS: My other family members wanted to order their Kalbi Short Ribs.. but they were all out!! - on a Sunday at 12pm - lunch time? When they just opened an hour ago? Whaaaaaa? - Either someone came in before us and ordered all their Kalbi.. or a major poor planing/food ordering issue going on.. Not sure about any other days, but it got really busy afterwards and people were getting bummed out that there was no Kalbi..  Other than that, well try this place out again in the future.  Enjoy!

Both burritos have similar ingredients, but only the beef rib burrito seems to be bursting with flavor.   We also tried the Crispy Tocino Spam Masubi.  Crazy tasty with a side of awesome! It is sweet and savory in just the perfect spots, with a crispy outside and juicy pork inside.  We've ordered from here multiple times now even though we know it's not good for us and I want to be avoiding meat. It is THAT good, and, warning: it will cause intense future cravings.

DkXWuq94wVKpSRYt7nk-Lg.text: My friend brought me here for lunch today as a little birthday surprise. We were greeted right away when we walked in and there was no line so I was happy about that.   I got the Kalua Pork Sisig in the kid size rice bowl with mac salad and my friend got the Kalbi Short Rib regular size rice bowl with mac salad and green salad.  It didn't take long before we got our food. My friend let me have a taste of his ribs and they were really delicious.   I really enjoyed the Kalua Pork.  The portion sizes are perfect and the price is just right!   I will def be back to try some of their other stuff.

q4asR1OAWsQhObIsRyWKdQ.text: I stumbled upon this place when I was looking for some good hawaiian food and I'm so glad I gave it a try! The restaurant is cozy and the food is delicious. I tried the crispy tocino spam musubi (a twist on regular spam musubi with crispy pork), kalua pork sisig taco, and an island plate with crispy pork belly sisig and kalbi short ribs. Their portion is very big so you'll definitely be full if you order the plate with two items. I'm bummed I didn't try their corn but I'll be back!

xYQ5P-U2zBOIwVdvbWUR2Q.text: Yummy and fast My bf and I shared a two entree two side meal along with a corn. We were both full at the end.   BBQ (boneless ribs) and crispy pork sisig  with macaroni and pinapple  We also each had a lemonade (their soda machine was out)   We liked the BBQ a lot more flavorful I LOVED my pinapple And the juice was a perfect match

pIU5JFLn7_5duND9C8z1jg.text: Super yummy when I ordered take out! Large portions! Would have gotten 5 stars if i would have received the teriyaki sauce in the side as requested but other than that it was great!

8-kFVAjCmrR-9_vImQWEmg.text: So yummy! And the employees are all super nice! Had garlic shrimp, pork belly, chicken katsu, RIB taco, and pineapple ice cream. All amazing.

mDDf2ZrKcekaGsBBndtoIw.text: Ummmm. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. I ordered Kalua Pork Nachos and Kalbi Short Rib Bowl. House Made Chips for Nachos were over-fried and greasy which made it not appetizing. For the bowl, white rice was very mushy. Kalbi was tasty which was good, but the Mac Salad was very bland. So sad because I was hoping to find a great Hawaiian place..

hxVpdF3vlEgaG1o4HSu33Q.text: Dinged a star because of two things: regular protein portion was a bit small for the price. They put enough rice to feed 3 people yet my meat was slack-a-lackin. Secondly, their mac salad was just a little watery for my taste. Other than that...their POG lemonade was delicious and refreshing and their kalbi ribs had amazing flavor. I'll definitely come back and try something new off the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RlTnS-GVGnQwvWKy3pAvOQ.text: Definitely get your ono grindz on here. Super friendly staff and really good food. I had the Notorious R.I.B. (Boneless Rib) Island rice bowl with Mac salad. Very tender! Good vibes in the whole place!

1PEavDumxgTWxtLUBxp7yQ.text: So when they first opened I tried it and nothing but deliciousness...tried it two more times and it was gross! Meat was chewy and purple, the rice was half undercooked and half over cooked, the chicken tasted weird and overall not good. Overpriced as well

Wg38q2RZ1Qtx7kcQJW2Xfg.text: My boyfriend and I came here last night for dinner after receiving a nice message on Yelp along with a $30 gift certificate from the owner, Ronnie. The second we walked through the door, we were immediately greeted by friendly staff. While looking through the menu, the staff were helpful in answering any questions we had. We saw that the wings were a new item on the menu and one of the guys at the front recommended it to us. Because we couldn't make up our mind what flavor to choose (either garlic or sriracha), it was nice of him to suggest that we could order it half and half so that we could try both. In addition, my boyfriend ordered his usual mix bowl- kalua pork and sesame chicken with mac salad and a green salad (which was also upon recommendation to try) and I ordered a regular bowl- crispy pork belly sisig with mac salad and edamame. We ordered the food to go and brought it home. To our surprise, my boyfriend's mixed bowl was now in a container which made it a lot better in presentation rather than it being packed in a large bowl. We also loved how that there was now an even ratio of meat, rice, and sides. As for the food, everything was delicious. We especially loved the wings. It was crispy and extremely flavorful.   Overall, the food and service here was fantastic! We were extremely happy with everything. We will definitely be back again. Mahalo Ronnie and the staff at Fist of Fusion.

UWLhlzjaX7uObVJDdVlArw.text: Got their garlic chicken and Notorious RIB. Both was ono and this place is one of my go to spots.

cobauOPqnFGFqYGoiteYZA.text: Delicious local Hawaiian Filipino food! Kalua pig nachos is a must! We've been here twice already and everything we have ordered has been on point. You have a choice of two sides - mac salad, edamame, veggies or a salad and you can pick either brown rice or white rice. The burritos are also a must! They are huge so make sure you tell them to cut it in half because you will likely need to save the other half for later! Check this place out!

v1hWbTE3GwLrajnKO567JQ.text: It's ok. Portion is enough for the price. The different kinds of elote is nice to have but the taste is better at the food truck. The musabi is a plus though. Food taste is not anything that would surprise me. Price, flavor, and portion are better at island flavor

MWbjKyEzhu2iufMjH-f0pw.text: We went for dinner last night, 7/13. First off the service was amazing. The girls behind the counter were awesome. It was our family's first time there. One in particular, who's name I didn't get, but definitely should have took the time to help my dad navigate the menu and order his food. Even though there was a line forming she didn't rush us to make a decision or make us feel pressured in any way. We finished paying and I had forgotten to order the UniCorn for my daughter. She added it on right away with no hesitation whatsoever.   While we waited for our food we got our drinks and my daughter colored with some of the crayons and paper provided.  Anything that keeps her busy while waiting for food is great with me. The wait was a little long but in their defense there was a lot of people who ordered, not only in store, but over the phone and grubhub as well. The food finally came and it was delicious! So worth the wait. We ordered one of each of the tacos, chicken katsu bowl, chicken salad, Notorious R.I.B., crispy pork belly, and sesame chicken. First off the Notorious R.I.B was MEAN!!! I could eat my weight in that meat it was so ONO... the kalua pig was a little salty but the sauce that came with it on the taco mellowed it out.. it was a perfect pairing... overall the food was great.. The girl who helped us at the register checked on us throughout dinner and even gave my daughter a tiny tiny cone of ice cream... she was awesome..I can't say enough good things about her...well done FOF..well done!

Q1gw3MTlzN-GSeEI0N_RPg.text: I came in after working and ordered the mixed bowl (2 proteins) with rice. I got the Notorious R.I.B (boneless ribs) and teriyaki chicken w/ a green salad and grilled pineapple. The Hawaiian-style  food was cooked perfectly with a sweet sauce. The ambience is very relaxing. Greeted with a "aloha" and some relaxing Hawaiian reggae. Great food, great atmosphere, great service! Will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DZYbEh_NOzoX5bLNevBAhg.text: Came here for lunch and had the sesame chicken bowl with 1/2 brown and 1/2 mac salad, grilled pineapple and green salad. The bubbly delicious Pepsi from their Pepsi fountain was the perfect compliment to lunch- thank you for serving my favorite soda!   Nice size portions of everything! The sesame chicken was very crispy which I love - soggy chicken is never a good thing- and the sauce was sweet and paired perfectly with the brown rice. The mac salad was one of the best I've had- creamy and full of flavor. The green salad was fresh green leaf lettuce with a light, sweet dressing. I saved the fresh grilled pineapple for last and it absolutely hit the spot.

qQw4AlHVbnhVN7uajVeI1w.text: 5 STARS! Best price for the quality and amount of food you receive! I had the mixed plate with Notorious RIB and Kalua Pork Sisig! Bomb af, for around $10 you get plenty of rice, 2 protein choices and 2 sides. No complaints here, I highly recommend going here if you love hawaiian food!

R2iTGw6kRES6AlE0fcJX2w.text: This place is total hype just been served with spoil macaroni never coming back to this place. Not a restaurant owner just regular customer, I did inform the counter crew of the spoiled macaroni. Not funny at all when your serve with a spoiled food.

GqeSRvkZM9KHUhnvHtR8mw.text: Came here with the family and food and service was excellent. We have the tocino spam, Garlic shrimp and kalbi. Quality was perfect and portions were huge! Will definitely come back here!

cjUK6xj1qT_xXeCochrdag.text: Was expecting more from all the reviews planned our family dinner . Overall the food was mediocre . The owner was super friendly as well as staff . We ordered the boneless ribs bowl . Sesame chicken bowl , with boneless ribs . And the pork bowl. The food was just ok .

GVvr5k82KsGTTO4PHyDSxA.text: Visiting from El Paso and wanted Hawaiian since we don't have any :/ Restaurant was clean . Their menu had a good variety . Also, had food I wouldn't normally see at a Hawaiian restaurant. They added their own twist.  On top of the food , the ice cream is probably my fav! The pineapple ice cream was ridiculously good! Love this place and would return

DeV4othDIcNte8jPMSvD4w.text: The R.I.B burrito was mouth-watering delicious!! I also picked up the pork belly appetizer to go with it :D It was crispy on the skin and the fat melted in my mouth. Service was great, music was legit Hawaiian and the ambience gave a sense of belonging. 10/10 will be coming back here for all my lunch and dinner needs!

9dmtO3h9vfD6w0RYdOz24Q.text: Food was delicious!!! portion was well worth the price!!! Employees were nice!!! Shrimp plate was ON POINT!!! Pork belly sisig and katsu was very flavorful!!! And the Loco Moco was of the wall!!! This was our first visit cause of convenience but not our last!!! Great job!!! Will be sharing my great experience with everyone!!!

NS6VDPcD0RyJhq6PUUeWlw.text: What a great new addition to the neighborhood! I had the Teriyaki Chicken, Mac Salad, and Grilled Pineapple- all absolutely delicious!!!

dRWXgFvpL4hkq3PTCQAlDA.text: I can't say enough about the food.  The menu is extensive and definitely creative with a flair for the staples of island food.  The gravy on the loco moco reminded me of grandpa.  The kailui pig nachos were shared amongst 4 family members and it still was enough to satisfy.  The restaurant is located away from the Las Vegas touristy crowd, which made the venture out worth the travel for this Oakland boy.

9VX-aEMV5UjXjM_FwLg1uw.text: I've been looking for a good Hawaiian Fusion place and luckily one opened up near my house! Many options on the menu that make my mouth drool just reading them! Great Customer service and most Importantly GREAT FOOD! Definitely coming back!

T9B7VajWDFFD6JsqojLVYA.text: Looking for some tasty, quick, fresh food?!? This is your place! Serving sizes are abundant. Definitely get your moneys worth. A must try!

9eeuQDaTJAl7iAV96alXmA.text: Tocino spam musubi, crispy pork belly in sweet dressing, and notorious R.i.b tacos are legit. This place Truely has the aloha spirit.  Added bonus is the churros. I felt like I was in Disneyland after my first bite.

uH9cOdYb9wxqGsVu5R9v3A.text: Some of the best Hawaiian fusion food I've had in town. They have a great take on some Hawaiian classics like spam musubi. Instead of just boring cabbage in your plates, they dress it up delightfully well. I high recommend this spot.

AgWd6rlM5UyNO4HSFFTcGg.text: It's a great different eatery that's off the strip. It was worth the trip out to get here. The menu has enough variety for Hawaiian style / Filipino food. The place is clean and the staff were wonderful. They have a very familiar Hawaiian style diner setup and the price is right.

yXDELFBh0gHE1PAPIVqiKQ.text: I got the crispy pork belly bowl which imo wasn't all that great.  i did like the crispy tocino spam musubi which was quite good but little pricey at $4+?  but i did want to try it.   would only go back if someone else wanted to eat there.

7pquETcLKSWfpBeoSW2VPQ.text: High priced for the quality and quantity of food. Staff was very friendly and service was great.

fmr_JkS_XFEdpiQOdB8bMQ.text: First time coming here. Food was great! Love the Kalua with unions and jalapeno cooked into it. Their lemonade is off the charts delicious!!! Best lemonade I've ever had. Wish I lived on this side of town, but will definitely eat here again when in the area. Good  food, great staff!

_K_pc_sBErD2HRliIwkvJg.text: Excellent!! The flavors are truly amazing and with an awesome island flare!!!

EhmtTHjtFyYvgppLUKLEyw.text: Awesome food and service! What more can you ask for??? The garlic shrimp and honey sesame tofu are my favorites.

cCRI8b4taQCjEwbzRV1xww.text: The service was great the food was fresh but I honestly didn't like the food.  The siding was good for the appetizer but for dinner I chose their signature burrito and I guess I didn't expect it to taste so sweet for a chicken teriyaki with rice and macaroni salad inside.  I appreciate their inventiveness so that it's not like L&L.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fJ8X-usCS_aQQ9Ndp_rLqQ.text: Sooo the wife and I were looking for places near by which had good reviews. I remember having a friend post a picture of the meals he had while he was there, boy did they look amazing. I asked the wife if she wanted to give Fist of Fusion a shot and she was on board.   I ordered the Loco Moco (which I have had at another place close by) and I have to truthful and say that this is probably the best Loco Moco I have ever had! The burger was cooked to perfecting, the egg was tasty, and the gravy with mushroom was absolutely delicious!   The wife ordered the Garlic Shrimp and she absolutely loved it. We placed an order for pick-up online and were a bit hesitant on if they would get things right. But they nailed it, the shrimp was peeled like we wanted and the order was flawless. I got a taste of her Garlic Shrimp and again, I wasn't let down. It was incredible.   I never post reviews on yelp, as this is my first one ever. I want this to be my first review because this place is freaking awesome. Although it's a start to explore more of the menu, we recommend this for all who are in the area and want a damn good meal for a great price.   Great Job Fist of Fusion and welcome to SW Las Vegas.

714DhFtcvI-asEfVx7CMfA.text: I really wanted to like this place. I went with my fam after church the inside was nicely decorated and staff was friendly. Island reggae tunes playing and even the menu looked promising. We ordered the garlic shrimp plate, notorious rib taco, elote, and the kids chicken teriyaki bowl.  Everything was so overly sweet and sugary! The shrimp were kinda soggy and elote was ok for four bucks.  It was worth a try but I don't see myself coming back when there are other solid options available.

7EYRTVsx4V555bzy5YFCgQ.text: yes!!! 100% they have a Katsu Chicken BURRITO!  It was an amazing piece of art! lol but also got to try their salads and their dressing is savory and a bit sweet! definitely recommend to try! 5 stars! also nice, clean and friendly restaurant!

zC3fSG4j6LhQRHRE5arz5w.text: Obsessed with this place!! Forever craving the Korean short ribs with a side of grilled pineapple.   This place is fire!!!!

U8_yneihsk30RHQOO-Hrbg.text: This place is AMAZING!!! The food is delicious, the service is great and the atmosphere is really inviting!! There's nothing on the menu over $10 and the portions are a good size! Martha works in the back and she is super friendly and bubbly! I will be back!!

zOVshTpmHZUjMcipxx0Big.text: Portions  Quality  Service  We loved the Notorious R.I.B. burrito & bowls ! Sooooo delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yj2rwvwLgz56S5xtRJ44KA.text: I was in the mood for some rice and anything and I Fist of Fusion and so glad I did!  I went to Hawaii last year and that was the last time I had a decent garlic shrimp dish until I found this place!   The shrimp were huge which was totally unexpected!  I didn't get shrimp that big in Oahu. Great taste and I couldn't even finish it. I will definitely go back! I highly recommend you try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Shrimp

6z6CHt9x7RS_PldZVQfHQw.text: As always some of the bad reviews leave you undecided to try a place for the first time.  Now that we have, we can't understand the negative ones as this was truly an excellent experience.   We had the Loco Moco, I have had it everywhere across the West Coast during my travels and I say this is one of, if not the best tasting ones I have ever had.  The patties were perfect size, egg cooked my way, and amazing gravy with mushrooms and onions. I had to order a side of gravy for the left over fried rice from the other meal since it was so good.  we also had the Garlic Shrimp meal which had 10 amazing pieces that were delicious.  It was so de to have something that is just outside the norm of the unusual Hawaiian type food.  The people were really nice and the owner/manager, whoever she was delivered my extra gravy and brought us a few ounces of her special Churro creations just to thank us. We will be back to try the rest of the menu items.

Z6VLHTQYOssmKzqrMfkDdQ.text: It's near my work so I tried this place for lunch the first time yesterday. Had to wait in line for a while and then it took 15 minutes for the food to be ready, but it was right after noon, so that's what I get for going during peak rush.   I ordered the large portion of pork belly sisig bowl with brown rice, macaroni salad and veggies. I appreciated the big portions and the everything was tasty. There were a few pieces of the pork skin that were over-fried to point of I couldn't chew them up, but that was not prevalent and I don't want to over-emphasize this.  Bottomline, I'm going to go back again, hopefully when it's less busy, and give it another try.

it9MhJDJhHQNMEGPYXRvBg.text: We ordered the Notorious RIB burrito, chicken katsu & pork belly, loco moco, kalua pork nachos, hot Cheetos and Uni-Corn elote and the lemonade. Everything was amazing! The staff were super friendly & we would def. go back!!!

aLarAAxrpsw0H0GVUoM7qw.text: This is the second time this week! The tacos are so good... I highly recommend the chicken taco.

nRTXWx68mzEFDd6O24zfPA.text: Lovely service! Friendly staff, very clean and nice atmosphere. I loved all the colors and options and how affordable it is! I appreciated the coloring pages and crayons even though I'm an adult, still helped with making the wait for food bearable. (Didn't take long I was just starving) I loved how bright and inviting it was in there. The elote is unique and delcious. I had the uni-corn my bf had the miso-corny elote. Both good but I preferred the uni-corn. The miso corny was a bit bold for my taste. Also this is where I found my love for musubi. The pink sauce is out of this world and I can't wait to go back to try their bowls!

4XvIIPYJBNNCza8I2fd9zQ.text: Loved loved loved the environment and people !! I was greeted immediately and i asked them what's your favorite "everything is amazing" i totally agree it was wonderful and amazing ! Even the ice cream was fireeee thank you for an amazing time ! And i had a conference call they didn't mind turning down the music just a little bit :)!!

st89YtOD0bVLNe92P-aypQ.text: Reviews about this place are pretty accurate. The pictures look great, however to food is anything but... My first time here, probably won't be back. Got the garlic shrimp plate and garlic chicken wing bowl. Shrimp LOOKED amazing and fried to a perfection, however they aren't fried at all... Whatever that is that's on the shrimp is wet mush, zero crunch. It was disappointing and I feel bamboozled. The wings had an amazing flavor but were overcooked! They were so tough to eat it was crazy, I was chewing so long my jaws hurt. The only thing I ate completely was the macaroni salad because I was so hungry and nothing else was cutting it. I went home a little less rich and still hungry.

jQ6KArVHEBvx7YvXNVkYJw.text: Tried this place twice and have been disappointed both times.  First time they ran out of pork belly sisig. Got the garlic shrimp and it wasn't that great.  Second time we were told pork belly sisig would take 30 minutes but we ended up waiting for our entire order for almost an hour (5 plates)   Overall, bad customer service.

Z8srX-Ucr75-t8DB7MXYsA.text: I've been here a few times now. The food taste great but they haven't been consistent with food portions, maybe different chef?? Anyway, the first time I ordered 2 bowls with 1 protein so I chose kalbi beef for one and sisig pork belly for the other. Generous portions and filling! The 2nd time I was telling my friends about it and raving how good everything was so we decided to order out. I ordered the same thing as my first and this time around the portions were significantly smaller, that was kind of disappointing especially after raving about this place to my friends. Now today after a long day at work I placed an order for pick up looking forward to my boneless short ribs & sisig pork belly with white rice... but instead I got brown rice and some breaded chk & my sisig pork belly. I had to check my order thinking maybe I chose the wrong options, but nope I didn't. Totally disappointed! And I think I even got charged extra for the boneless kalbi ribs that I didn't even get. I wish I checked my order before leaving because I'm way too tired to drive there after working a 10 hr shift. But at least they got my bf's order right, I'll just have to eat some of his kalbi beef ribs!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Idk what the breaded item is called, but it&#39;s chk &amp; I wanted boneless kalbi ribs.  I wanted white rice not brown.
Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The online order I placed, but they gave me the wrong food.

ISzLK3_3dRed6ij1lasUFg.text: Loved the food I ordered. Honey Sesame tofu was so good. I have to get some before I leave Vegas. It was my first time there. The combination of HS Tofu, Macaroni salad, and brown rice was PERFECTION.

WS_XGJXOel5WOJCFBh43YA.text: Did I just have a different experience compared to everyone else? I was disappointed at the food. I ordered the sesame chicken with brown rice, mac salad and stir fry veggies. My bowl was basically 70% rice with a few pieces of what tasted like chicken katsu and the mac salad lacked any flavor. My favorite part of the bowl was the stir fry veggies.   My brother and I also ordered the kalua pork nachos to share. This was the highlight of our meal. I wish we had more of that cilantro lime sauce !

HIL_RDURUWNX4nBroTWXAQ.text: I have to say that the food here is amazing!  Great Hawaiian style food with some Asian influence!  Friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere and Owner Ronnie is the man!  Definitely come check out this local Vegas restaurant.  Highly recommend!!!

Mc4pXMmwf2KYy4Cdos_43Q.text: Not a good experience my first time here. I ordered the chicken katsu and the chicken was a brown/grey color and, for lack of a better word, slimy inside (see image); I ended up not eating most of it. The katsu sauce had way too much cinnamon in it. The mac salad was bland and the edamame was nothing special. I can't say I'd recommend this place based on this visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R3Pwr8Vn8NWUnAfzZcgylA.text: Okay, so I initially thought to myself, 'This is like any other Hawaiian/Asian Fusion place', but I was so wrong! THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD!!! It is all my favorite kind of food in one place. I can get my Hawaiian, Asian (Dominantly Filipino influences), and Mexican food fix all at one place. The fact they have elotes here is what made me consider coming here.  I ordered the mango chicken tacos but for whatever reason I didn't get the mango salsa on my order. Nevertheless, it was still good. You get to order between corn or flour tortillas.  My husband ordered the kalua pig/sisig and Kalbi plate. I tried his food, and I got so freaking excited! The kalbi had a good amount meat on it; none of those skinny ass ribs you would normally find. They tasted so good! I was blown away when I tried the kalua pig/sisig 'cause it was like no other kalua pig I've tried before. It's a bit tangy, which is what made me literally obsess over it. Almost like a Sinigang tamarind sort of taste.   Definitely worth driving from the north west. We're coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CMjioKwLeqzIorvyqR0pZw.text: I'm happy that my husband made me try this place! Everything we ordered was "Ono" (good).  We enjoyed our dishes while listening to Hawaiian- Reggae jams.  The owner recommended the chicken plate lunch burrito.  I need to think about this one for next time.  Being from Hawaii I feel that its wrong to put a plate lunch in a burrito (just my opinion).  I'm sure it's good but not ready for this combo.     We ordered the garlic shrimp plate, crispy pork belly sisig bowl, crispy spam musubi and the Notorious RIB taco.  All were delicious especially with the pairing of POG lemonade.  I was kind of sad there was no corn, but heard it was just for today.  We will be back to try the corn!!! Thanks for bringing this Ono food to the southwest!!!

Photo of Fist of Fusion Island Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mcRo6_YjV13IJScEsa-XAg.text: Tasty spin on Hawaiian Food located in the Southwest area.   I stopped by here for dinner tonight and ordered taco sisig, regular teriyaki chicken bowl with grilled veggies & Mac salad, and regular boneless ribs bowl with veggies & Mac salad.   I preferred the teriyaki chicken over boneless ribs, but I must say the taco sisig was the most impressive and super tasty.   Portion size for both bowls and sisig were right. Actually a bit more than what we expected. So price was just right.   I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking to try new Hawaiian food in the southwest area.

kr7bUSURrkpUgOxrgMQqWA.text: For the record, the service was great, but I didn't come to this place to hang out with their staff. It really surprised me how poorly executed the meal was. Like literally it was offensive. The Notorious RIB texture wise came out like mush, guessing someone boiled the meat in the marinade as opposed to sauteing it and probably did it for 3+hours. The Crispy Pork Belly SiSig was essentially pork belly / skins mixed with Kalua pork. Which sadly the kalua pork was so over cooked, it was salty mush, and the pork belly seemed like it was three to four times cooked, because it was so chewy and dry it was actually inedible. And the cilantro lime sauce that was supposed to compliment the sisig? Well I'm pretty sure it was a sour cream base for the sauce because that's all I tasted.   I gave my meal away.

qS9BIDLbdFsUJVmoEwVlPA.text: I've been following this site intensely on Instagram for a few months and was excited to be finally be on this side of town to experience the food from the pics (who ever posts to their IG, kudos! You had me salivating!).   I had the garlic shrimp plate with steamed rice, macaroni salad, and a side of greens with no dressing (kind of mad I didn't the coleslaw from the pics!). Super satisfied with the shrimp; so big, very great garlic flavor and amazingly seasoned. Macaroni salad looked delicious, but lacked taste, and rice was a bit wetter than I'd hoped.   I took away a star because it was empty, and not busy, but most tables were dirty, and the floors were dirty. It's a turn off to eat in a place where you couldn't get comfy while you ate. The Tapatio bottle was SUPER grimy and greasy, and it was needed for the flavorless Mac salad.   I'll come back again to try the pork or have the shrimp again (with brown rice and no greens), and maybe bring my own Tapatio.
