2lY1_q8RhS3FUtu7GphETg.text: Fam and I went to this place after seeing so many pics of the food. It was a little farther for us to get to but it was well worth it. The place is small, seats about 20-25 people...maybe. A bit congested if the place was full. It has a cool wall painting.   We ordered the R.I.B burrito, a couple of bowls (rice, crispy pork belly, R.I.B meat, chicken katsu, Mac salad), Mexicorn and Cheetoscorn, and Kailua pork nachos. The food was very delicious, good portions, and pleasing to the eyes.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Hawaiian/Island food. The staff and the chefs were awesome, great customer service and very friendly. I'll be coming back real soon!

qBemISQCf6HreXsjPkvO3Q.text: SO TASTY. Easy to make healthy, and the tofu rice bowl was an awesome vegan option. The sides were also amazing, we had the Mac & Cheese, and grilled pineapple. I'd never had anything like this before and definitely don't regret it!

hf95tSYrTfTe22BHEUg3pw.text: I really like this place it is at the top of my favorite local mixed plate Hawaiian spots, their garlic shrimp is very good. The food quantity is also very good I've only eaten here via take- out the food is excellent!

jlydYLXiKTFHowH7x1jBFg.text: Chicken katsu bowl and macaroni salad.. I crave it often! That's the only dish that I can speak on because it's the only one I've tried. So good that I don't have the need to venture out and try anything else on the menu. It's my go-to. Cute little place conveniently located on Buffalo and Warm Springs.

z-8YiNYbg9DjO_tq1h6hEQ.text: Came here because fukuburger was jam packed. Idk how to review this without being disrespectful but this is hands down the worst Hawaiian food I've had in LV. it wasn't busy when I went but I had to wait 33 minutes for my food. The katsu was lack luster with zero flavor. The rice was stiff and tasted old. And the mac salad was inedible. The only thing I ate on my plate was my grilled pineapple which is impossible to ruin. If service was decent maybe I wouldn't be so bothered but it sucks when the food is terrible and the service is poop.

dFkZRw6-SJcYKN3lL_1e5A.text: I decided to try this place 1- I'm from Hawaii, 2- the line at the new Fukuburger location was long. There was only one couple ahead of me in line.   I ordered the chicken katsu with MAC salad and grilled pineapple. While I waited, I asked to sample their ube ice cream. That was delicious. Everyone was super friendly, the vibe is chill, exactly what you'd expect from an island joint.   When my order was called, I was a little surprised at how small the bowl was. Typically, True local-style restaurants give you a lot of food. It was $9, which is about the same cost of a plate from Ohana BBQ or L&L's. I also tipped them (for being so friendly.)  The chicken katsu was so underwhelming. It was disappointing. The little cup of sauce isn't even enough to last through your whole meal, and that says a lot since the meat portion isn't generous by any means. (Especially if you're craving chicken katsu, this location is close enough to Ohana BBQ on Durango, you might as well go there. Much tastier and larger portions.) The mac salad was by far, the worst I've ever tasted. Absolutely NO flavor. Even the rice didn't taste good... how do you mess up WHITE RICE at an island spot? Sadly, the best part was the grilled pineapple.   So I guess if you're looking for good grilled pineapple, this is your spot.   but if you're looking for good local food- this isn't it.

J4IB56gIDWxKdAlRZXTYKA.text: Filipino-Hawaiian fusion food is right up my alley so I was excited to check this place out. Staff was friendly and service was fairly quick.   We ordered a keiki size Notorious RIB, the new garlic chicken plate, and a kalua pork sisig taco. The RIB short rib was so tender! The flavors were well developed and it reminded me of something my mom would make. Total comfort food. The bowl came with rice, a cabbage slaw, and I chose the mixed veggies as my side. The garlic chicken plate is a new item that was posted near the register. It had chicken wings coated in the same sauce as the garlic shrimp (per the staff member) and came with rice, Mac salad, and green salad - but we opted for mixed veggies instead. Chicken wings were good but nothing spectacular. It's definitely a flavor I've had at other places. The Mac salad was really bland and greasy for some reason. The mixed veggies on both dishes were cooked just the way I like them - a little on the soft side. The taco had a good amount of pork and the taco shell was fresh. But, it was a kalua pork SISIG taco and none of the tangy, spicy sisig flavors were there. If anything, it was a little under seasoned.   Overall, not a bad meal. There are lots of other menu items I'd like to give a try someday.

M7t053GOa1BwuoMY-98Pzw.text: Heard about another local food spot just opened in Vegas. Always always stay down when comes to local food not only because from 808 but best comfort food ever two scoops rice, mac salad, and entree. I must admit had my reservations cause over the past twenty years living in Vegas (or locals know call Vegas the ninth island) almost over saturated with local spots. The ones that truly stand out for me is individual family own restaurant nothing to do with chains (not that hater still good). Not only does Fist of Fusion Island Grill stand out writing it or saying it out loud. It truly embodies Ohana. I never had conversation with Ronnie or Lisa but reading other reviews. Chef Ronnie was making the rounds asked me how was everything I had for lunch. A new business when see the owner takes time out to come out get feedback from every guest. Not only does it show his passion for his food, also like past review shows that each customer is not customer but part of the Ohana, and felt like living back in the 808.  So first impression was talk about feeling the Aloha spirit! Not only on the wall with coolest sign that the world needs more of. The staff shouting out Mahalos and welcome. They were consistent with every one that came in the hour chilling having my lunch. It small restaurant but has lot of personality in it. The art work on the wall soon walk in. It pretty much covers that whole wall. It looks very much original. It vibrant colors that screams at you. Hula girl with ukulele. Just chilling on the beach. The shaka sign from the logo to the open and close sign on the door. The sit down counter area. It screams personality but very much 808. Above they have three wide screens. The music!!!! So awesome!!! It totally local style Hawaiian music.  The food the menu has nice diversity to it. It not huge menu. It broken down to bowls, burritos, tacos, salads, apps, and ono grindz. It was my first visit not sure where to start. I know the Crispy Torino Span Musubi. One of the reasons came. I have been in this non spam musubi style kick. I seen the katsu style spam musubi but never had one. Talk about WINNAH. I know seen others that the whole musubi is deep fried. Never had so no going compare. I feel Crispy Torino Spam Musubi. If going katsu style this does Spam Musubi right. Only the Spam that breaded katsu style with the panko action. The rest of it is normal spam musubi. The part that separates Crispy Torino Spam Musubi from nothing had before is the tocino sauce. It perfect compliment to the crispy breading with what tastes like aioli based sauce or am guessing. Good. My entree went with the Sesame Chicken Bowl. The bowl comes in three different sizes. I went with the large. Talk about choke food. I was hungry after morning swim set. The amount of chicken give you is local style, the two scoops of rice is mound not scoop, and bowls come with choice of sides. I went with mac salad (cause dah two scoops rice mac salad need I say more) and stir fry vegetables. The mac salad was solid and the stir fry vegetables was nice medley of all fresh vegetables nice crispy and tell fresh vegetables. I was loved the sauce that coated the chicken and then get some on the side. All good stuff.  Little touch comes details. All the bowls or notice all the bowls coming out that day. They had flower in them. It nice one that see back home. All I was thinking if going out of way make it feel like Hawaii that nice touch.   No doubt plan on coming back because close to my house. The boneless short ribs other dish torn apart to try first. This churro missed out on need try some of that too. Till the next time...

6E8LutW-pwco5zrNOMvcFw.text: Being an islander and trying alot of island themed restaurants here in Vegas I give my hat off to fist of fusion. Best island food in vegas. I had the mixed plate with kalbi short ribs and crispy pork belly. The short ribs were cooked so tender and the pork belly was beautifully crisp and perfectly flavored. My sister had break your mouth burrito. It was nice and hot all the ingredients in it had tons of flavor and was well worth the wait. If your looking for good island comfort food this is the place to get it. Thank you guys for such an amazing lunch and I will be back.

73wpmWVBJLjdwapKttVUww.text: I miss this place since I left Vegas I've had a craving every day for 3 months. The notorious big with no Mac salad and no kimchi but extra of the chipotle sauce. It's like heaven. Aw heaven man now I'm hungry again. Please try this in your lifetime. Theirs also a story behind this place and how it got it's name and even how it ended up in Vegas. The music tho is always WAY to loud but the food is so fantastic. Honestly it's worth going out of your way on your trip you will thank me. The nachos are also super good but 100% messy lol not date food and prob extra napkins are a must. Just go try it why are you still reading?

Wp7Th2T8nHa_0JexyqQ_Ag.text: Currently my favorite Hawaiian  place to go to. I always get the pink lemonade for my drink and the shrimp plate. I also like their pork sisig here I've ordered it like 3 times already. If ever I want Hawaiian food just cuz I'm lazy to make my own I definitely go back here. Most definitely I need to try something different  rather than my regular that always get..

6BHN2YyTQZMRkuPEdaLfTQ.text: I love that there's a new quick Hawaiian fusion spot nearby! What lured me in was the sisig everything! Lmao I was excited to see what it's all about here. I heard good things about this place and I knew it was fairly new so here we're going to be some flaws.  I love their menu options and the selection. It's a cute small joint that serves it purpose and does a good job! My only critique is once you place your order it does take quite a while to receive your order. I do understand that they make your order fresh to order, but it does take longer than usual.   I admit the wait was worth it, I love the sweet and salty savory taste of the Crispy Pork Belly appetizer (plus when I came in it was free with a yelp check in!). I order a rice bowl with the crispy pork as well and it was basically the same as the appetizer but I didn't mind it! It was still sooo amazing and yummy! I will be coming back to try more! Good job Fist of Fusion!

5Fh1VHtGiSY87mYkidrMqw.text: Sesame Chicken w/ crispy pork belly, 2 scoop rice, Mac salad and grilled veggies. First time here and the food is pretty good. The wait time isn't too bad, about 5 minutes for my food. The seating sucks. If it was a better layout where it wasn't a can of sardines then 5 stars would've been chosen. Space is small. I don't know how it would be on a regular day during lunch or dinner I'm guessing it's pretty busy here or just seems that way because of how tiny the seating area is

AVCBmmsAmMxC9OQvJt_plA.text: My family was traveling from out of town and our last day in Vegas a friend posted a video of their chicken dinner burrito. I just had to have it. We stopped by on our way out of town and my family of four split two katsu chicken burritos. It tasted so good! We were all full and happy. On top of that the staff was wonderful and the location was clean. Even the kitchen staff in back of house came out to check on us and ask how it was. Really wish we had this closer definitely recommend!

KvwCnG5KJ_BS2_gsQh8h1g.text: A whole freaking hour wait for our food. I usually have good patience for food industries because I understand, but no apologies, no concern at the fact that we had been waiting this long. They just didn't care. Front of the house seemed a bit rude, not very friendly.  People who came in after us getting their food first.  Just a horrendous and horrible experience.

f7BGxzSCB-hHN7qzc2dWcg.text: Omgggggg the food here was enough for a family of 4 to take home, fall asleep, wake up and finish. That burrito with the kalbi ribs, the nachos, the Cheeto-lote, bowls, everything was PHENOMENAL. CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!!! Although them being right up the street will likely hurt my bank account lol

d0yXKChNgqtvS7kJ3HywrQ.text: Ommmmmmg I can't say enough about this place!!!! The food was better than it appears in pictures. The service was outstanding and it's a really clean place. The prices are fantastic for the amount of food you get. I could only eat half my bowl and had to bring the rest home it was amazing. I love good service too and they were amazing so friendly and timely I love it. We'll definitely be here at least twice a month

H_s59LjEmlbGmbUy8RUU_w.text: Nice and home atmosphere. Great food and great staff. Keep up the good work. At first i thought it would be your typical hawaiian fusion place. But it wasnt. You get this feeling like your on the island.

1PXjxuOuJux02y2EreI9ig.text: First time eating here and it was sooo delicious! I ordered the Kalua pork nachos and the sauce was to die for! Everything about was perfect and it filled me up pretty quick. I also tried the crunchy spam musubi and I'm normally a person who just likes to stick to the regular musubi but wow this one was a game changer. There's a pink sauce on it that tastes so good and the crunch of the breaded spam was on point! I also tasted a garlic shrimp from my boyfriends plate and thought that was close to the garlic shrimp from Hawaii. Lastly I tried the Ube and pineapple ice cream in a Keiki cup and the flavor was delicious! Totally recommend making room for that after your meal. The shop itself was very clean and ascetically pleasing reminded me of home. The workers were so friendly always checking up on my family and I. 14/10 recommend coming here and spreading the aloha! I'll be back for sure!

6CSA82MbpB7yH6Z9kuRjRQ.text: Brand new to the southwest, its a new Hawaiian/Filipino fast casual that has a great menu with savory dishes. The employees are friendly and the place is clean. If you are in the southwest area by Buffalo and Warm Springs stop by and satisfy your taste buds.

YzrEMv8V6j99lkF0PaXf7w.text: yum the grilled pineapple is amazing. The pork belly appetizer. Overall it's a great nice place to the neighborhood

eC7ZM1WEWDePp_sdh37MYw.text: This place has awesome food!  Everything on the menu is great and the portions are humongous.  Everyone that works there is so courteous and they make your food so fast.  I go there every week.

QMpZil_1F8CPZO04LReGWQ.text: I tried out the Garlic Chicken plate it was very good and enough to feed two people.  Definitely will be going back and trying other plates, thanks for the delicious food.

NM5LVffxSfx-yuhh5y-d0Q.text: Very good food compared to others however the last three to go orders was out to the ordinary, I hate calling back and and complain because I love going back to this place but I hit my limits of complaining. Thanks fist of fusion but no thanks.

WTcSBAXqj3ykLm5mRKdVSg.text: Piggy backing on my previous review, I must say the owners went above and beyond in rectifying my issue on January 23rd. Not only did they reached out and apologize but they also replaced my order with 2 huge burritos and a nice chicken plate!  I can honestly say this is customer service at its best!!Replacing my order would have been sufficient so the extra add ons were truly an unexpected pleasant surprise!!  Thank you Lisa and Ronnie!!

Pf7Vq50E6sVVbSEOgKLFQg.text: First timer...I usually stay away from anything with the word "fusion" in it, ESPECIALLY local (hawaiian) food. My local food should be, well, local food. Call me old fashioned but if I'm craving local food, I'd like it to be how it supposed to be, not "fused" It's kinda like having a favorite song you had since small kid time, but then somebody else sings it and changes it up... doesn't sound right huh? But it was on the way home so I decided to try it. I was greeted as soon I came in, the staff is full of aloha, very helpful. Clean, comfortable environment. I asked what was the popular dish and they suggested the notorious rib, so I got that. Took it home and ate it...meh... it's different. They put a sauce on it where the first couple bites were good, but then I got used to the flavor and it didn't appeal to me anymore. Not sure if I'll come back, this is just my opinion, I'm sure a lot of people like it

Bzlh88IFF5GQbZ5-JKfagg.text: I remember the food truck days. Food is always on point. Friendly staff. Clean restaurant. \m/

E_0UK1iPfrg3bWhuZt6WWA.text: The food was amazing especially the pulled pork nachos! Also had the garlic shrimp with grilled pineapple it was so tasty and loved the garlic with easy peal shrimp. Can't wait too try the rest of the menu. I don't really post on yelp but can't help say this was some amazing island food!!!

ePzmo-9HUSSjzSwxKm8Yqg.text: Food is good but the service is trash. Good luck in even getting what you ordered. There's just a bunch of kids working there and the music is too loud that they probably can't even hear what you're ordering. but instead of verifying with you, they just place the wrong order and you only find that out until you've waited forever just to get the wrong thing. Went in with 2 friends and all three of us had our order wrong in one way or another. The lady who seemed to be the owner said she would correct it, and she let us keep the mistake order...but then we never even got the correct food in the end. Pathetic. We were tired of waiting that we just left. Sucks because we tipped them $5 at the register but this was before we knew what we were getting ourselves into.

quJZz6ihS87R5Q0Z8z0kww.text: Cute place. Had the kalua pork bowl and the short rib bowl. Both very good. Washed down with the POG lemonade - good, b

ICQba6uL9pDetFO7hOhB6Q.text: This is our 2nd time here.  Their food has been amazing.  Customer service is great!  Employees go above and beyond.

WqqbRCb78fW_fCpjQ_QTWA.text: Saw this place on a video on FB. Just had to try it out. I love plate lunches in Hawaii and thought the  burrito was interesting. Definitely would recommend this place! Get your Katsu Chicken lunch plate!Delicious! Ono!

SnUw-loZZneremu9KC9hZw.text: A must try is the Kahlua Pork Nachos.  This Hawaiian Fusion Restaurant is definitely a must for anyone who is a True Foodie. Their island style incorporates Hawaiian inspired dishes served in a burritos/tacos/bowls style.  I know this sounds boring but favorite dish is the Sesame Chicken and Honey Sesame Tofu.  So for you Veggie eaters, there's even dishes made just for your discriminating taste.  Ask for the free Hawaiian style Churros.

Sg_d_wPLXFKuz0U4D3mRnQ.text: Not such a great place to eat. Obnoxious music always playing in the restaurant with the volume on blast. The cashier seemed nice at first, but when I said I was ok on an explanation of the menu, she started giving me attitude when I was ordering. Hawaiian food is mediocre. Could be better. Again, L&L probably tastes the best.

OhFtPmE-qitfrKNseLaWrg.text: Portions, MASSIVE. Food, DELICIOUS. Service, exceptional from the time we were greeted when we walked in, to the time we were thanked by someone walking to the car! Just moved a block away a month ago and my roommate and I will TOTALLY be back!
